column2:
'''akti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is running service  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo akti''' — active, in action, working, in operation. '''lo se akti''' — active operation. 
:'''i gau ko ta to'e akti''' — ''Turn that off.''
:'''i gau ko ta akti''' — ''Turn it on.''
:'''i mi ba jai gau akti fai le minji''' — ''I will get the machine running.''
:'''i le zarci ca akti''' — ''The shop is open.''
:'''i le minji ca akti lo ka cupra lo purmo''' — ''The machine is now in operation producing flour.''
:Related words: {zukcfu}, {spofu}
column7: x1 ca'a zilpilno x2
column26: active, in action, working, in operation

column16: is an alder, a tree of genus Alnus of species

column2:
'''ankabuta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a spider of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ankabuta''' — spider. 
:'''i xu do terpa tu'a lo ankabuta''' — ''Are you afraid of spiders?''
:Related words: {insekto}, {cinki}, {danlu}

'''arte''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a piece of artwork
:'''lo arte''' — piece of artwork. 
:'''i le vi arte pu jai rinka so'i nu darlu''' — ''There've been a lot of debates caused by this artwork.''
:Related words: {larcu}, {finti}, {pixra}

'''arxokuna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a raccoon of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo arxokuna''' — raccoon. 
:'''i pa arxokuna cu zvati le mi kumfa co nu jukpa''' — ''There's a raccoon in my kitchen.''
:Related words: {danlu}, {mabru}

'''tolckire''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  feels resentment, bitterness towards  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for action  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo tolckire''' — resentful. 
:'''i mi pu tolckire le ninmu lo ka tarti lo xlali''' — ''I felt resentful of this lady's bad behavior.''
:Related words: {to'e}, {ckire}

'''asna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  is a posture, stance, asana of body  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo asna''' — posture (of body), body position, stance (of body), asana. 
:'''i ra co'a se asna pa ckape ne'a le barda fenra''' — ''He took a dangerous pose near the abyss.''
:Related words: {morna}
column16: is a posture, stance, asana of body
column26: posture (of body), body position, stance (of body), asana

column2:
'''bacru''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  utters  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(sound, text)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se bacru''' — uttered text or sound. 
:'''i ko na cladu bacru''' — ''Don't talk loud.''
:'''i le nakni pu bacru lu pa no li'u''' — ''He said "Ten".''
:Comment: {bacru} is @@@to vocally utter an actual sound@@@, {cusku} is @@@to say some text@@@ (which can be in any form including vocal)
:Related words: {krixa}, {cusku}, {casnu}, {tavla}, {voksa}, {pinka}

'''bajra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  runs on surface  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  using limbs  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo bajra''' — runner. 
:'''i mi bajra vi'i lo mitre be li ci ki'o''' — ''I ran three thousands meters.''
:'''i xu do su'o roi senva lo ka bajra lo jdika grana loi xance be do''' — ''Have you ever dreamt of running on your hands on a narrow rod?''
:Comment: doesn't necessarily imply any destination point. {bajra} {muvdu} can be used to describe both moving to and from some places by running.
:Related words: {cadzu}, {klama}, {litru}, {stapa}, {plipe}, {cpare}
column7: x1 litru x2 x3 noi tuple x1 ku'o ta'i lo nu su'o roi ro nu stapa kei no lo tuple cu pencu lo loldi
column25: doesn't necessarily imply any destination point. {bajra} {muvdu} can be used to describe both moving to and from some places by running.
column41: x1 runs on surface x2 using limbs x3 with gait x4 ||| (cf. cadzu, klama, litru, stapa, plipe, cpare)

'''balvi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is in the future of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is later than x<sub>2</sub>
:'''lo balvi''' — later event, future event. '''lo se balvi''' — earlier event, past event. 
:'''i lo nu la kevin cu cliva pu balvi lo nu mi tsuku le xotli''' — ''Kevin left, and that happened after my arrival to the hotel.''
:Related words: {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}
column7: x1 se lidne x2 lo'e temci porsi .i x1 se purci x2
column41: x1 is in the future of/later than/after x2 in time sequence; x1 is latter; x2 is former ||| [also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= cfabalvi); (default x2 is the space time reference, whereupon:) x1 will occur]; (cf. lidne, cabna, purci, farna)

'''bancu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is beyond boundary  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''i da lalxu gi'e bancu le tcadu''' — ''There is a lake beyond the city.''
:'''i lo tai fasnu cu bancu lo se kakne be mi''' — ''Such things are beyond my powers.''
:'''i le zdani cu bancu le vu tricu ti lo ka darno ti''' — ''The house is beyond those trees from here in how far it is from here.''
:Related words: {zildukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}
column7: x1 zmadu x2 lo ka ce'u darno x3 x4
column41: x1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2 from x3 in property/amount x4 (ka/ni) ||| [on the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per ragve); also not limited to position in space]; (cf. dukse, ragve, zmadu, kuspe)

'''brisni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a clause with the main verb  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  that has arguments  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(ordered text group)</sub>''

:'''i lu mi dunda ti do li'u brisni zo dunda zo mi ce'o zo ti ce'o zo do''' — ''"I give this to you." is a clause with the main verb "give" that has sequential places "I","this","you".''

column2:
'''bridi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is a predicate relationship with the main relation  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of nonce place, has places for {ce'u} applied to x3)</sub>''  and having arguments  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(ordered entity group)</sub>'' 
:'''i le du'u mi dunda ti do cu bridi lo ka dunda vau mi ce'o ti ce'o do''' — ''That I give this to you is a relationship with the main relation of giving and sequential arguments being me, this and you.''
:'''i le du'u mi prami do cu bridi lo ka ce'u prami ce'u vau mi ce'o do''' — ''That I love you is a grammatical relationship with the main relation of someone loving someone and the roles being me and you correspondingly.''
:Related words: {sumti}, {fancu}

column6: _+Also: x3 are related by relation x2 (= {terbri} for reordered places). (x3 is a sequence completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

column2:
'''cabra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is apparatus for function  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  controlled by agent  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cabra''' — apparatus. '''lo se cabra''' — function of an apparatus. 
:'''i ti cabra lo ka zalvi lo gurni vau lo xance''' — ''This is a hand-controlled machine for grinding grain.''
:Comment: {cabra} is for devices controlled by external force, {minji} is for machines working automatically, {zmiku} is for robots in general.
:Related words: {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}, {girzu}, {ganzu}, {pilno}
column25: {cabra} is for devices controlled by external force, {minji} is for machines working automatically, {zmiku} is for robots in general.

:Comment: {jdima} is for cost/price/value distinction.

column5: _-Also (adjective:) x1, x2, x4 is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}). x2/x3 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})
column6: _+x2/x3 may be a specific object, a commodity, an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})
column7: joi gi x1 cpacu x3 boi x4 gi x4 cpacu x2 boi x1
column25: {jdima} is for cost/price/value distinction.
column41: x1 exchanges/trades/barters commodity x2 for x3 with x4; x1, x4 is a trader/merchant/businessman ||| [also (adjective:) x1, x2, x4 is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, kamcanja)]; x2/x3 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posycanja for unambiguous semantics); (cf. dunda, friti, vecnu, zarci, jdini, pleji, jdima, jerna, kargu; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, banxa, cirko, dunda, janta, kargu, prali, sfasa, zivle)

column2:
'''canko''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a window or portal in wall or building  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo canko''' — window. '''lo se canko''' — building with a window. 
:'''i le canko be le karce cu kalri''' — ''The window in the car is open.''
:Related words: {vorme}, {bitmu}, {ganlo}, {murta}, {pagre}, {kevna}, {jvinu}, {kalri}, {kuspe}
column7: x1 kevna lo sefta be x2 noi mu'a bitmu gi'a dinju gi'a stura
column16: is a window or portal in wall or building
column41: x1 is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure x2 ||| (cf. vorme, bitmu, ganlo, murta, pagre, kevna, jvinu, kalri, kuspe)

column2:
'''canlu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a space or room occupied by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo canlu''' — space. 
:'''i lo canlu be le purdi cu barda''' — ''The garden occupies a large space.''
:Related words: {kensa}, {bliku}, {kumfa}, {kevna}, {kunti}, {tubnu}, {dekpu}
column7: x1 mucti gi'e se zvati je vasru je culno x2
column16: is a space or room occupied by
column41: x1 is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by x2 ||| [also occupy (= selca'u)] (cf. kensa, bliku, kumfa, kevna, kunti, tubnu, dekpu)

column2:
'''canpa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a shovel or spade for doing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo canpa''' — shovel. 
:'''i ti canpa lo nu kakpa lo dertu vau ji lo nu katna lo genja''' — ''Is this spade for digging ground or for cutting roots?''
:Related words: {kakpa}, {guska}, {tutci}
column7: x1 tutci lo ka ve kakpa x2
column16: is a shovel or spade for doing
column41: x1 is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging x2 ||| (cf. kakpa, guska, tutci)

column2:
'''canre''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some sand or grit ...
:'''lo canre''' — sand. 
:'''i mi pu zvafa'i lo jamfu prina be lo canre''' — ''I found some footprints in the sand.''
:'''i mi pu se nandu lo ka cadzu lo canre poi gunma lo cmalu rokci''' — ''It was hard for me to walk on the sand made of small stones.''
:Related words: {bidju}, {rokci}, {zalvi}, {boxna}
column7: x1 cmalu bidju be lo rokci be x2
column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source x2 of composition including x3 ||| [also abrasive (= gukcanre)]; (cf. bidju, rokci, zalvi, boxna)

column2:
'''canti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the intestines or guts of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo canti''' — intestine, gut. 
:'''i lo jurme co'a xabju lo canti be lo cifnu ba zi lo nu ri jbena''' — ''Bacteria colonize the intestines of a child soon after it is born.''
:Related words: {betfu}
column16: is the intestines or guts of
column41: x1 is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of x2 ||| [metaphor: process hub]; (cf. betfu)

column2:
'''carce''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a carriage or wagon with wheels for carrying  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo carce''' — carriage. '''lo se carce''' — cargo of a carriage. 
:'''i mi sazri pa carce be lo karce''' — ''I am driving a car transporter.''
:Comment: {carce} is designed to be with wheels, {marce} isn't and is more generic.
:Related words: {karce}, {xislu}, {marce}, {matra}
column16: is a carriage or wagon with wheels for carrying
column25: {carce} is designed to be with wheels, {marce} isn't and is more generic.
column41: x1 is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3 ||| (cf. karce, xislu, marce, matra)

column2:
'''carmi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is bright or intense in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo carmi''' — bright, intense. 
:'''i ei do carmi lo ka tadni''' — ''You should study hard.''
:'''i ti noi bombila cu carmi lo ka te gusni''' — ''This light bulb gives a bright light.''
:Related words: {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}
column7: x1 mutce x2 fi'o ganse x3 .i x1 to'e kandi x2 x3
column41: x1 is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) x2 as received/measured by observer x3 ||| [also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi)]; (cf. denmi, gusni, kandi, ruble, skari, tilju, tsali, mutce, blabi, blanu, bunre, cicna, crino, grusi, narju, nukni, pelxu, xekri, xunre, zirpu)

column2:
'''carna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  turns or rotates around axis  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in direction  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo carna''' — rotating. '''lo se carna''' — axis of rotation. '''lo te carna''' — direction of rotation. 
:'''i ko carna klama lo pritu''' — ''Turn to the right.''
:'''i ko pritu carna''' — ''Turn right.''
:'''i le xislu pu carna lo grana lo zunle ki lo galtu''' — ''The wheel was rotating around the rod counterclockwise when viewed from above.''
:Comment: in x<sub>3</sub> use {lo pritu} for clockwise movement and {zunle} for counterclockwise movement.
:Related words: {gunro}, {jendu}
column7: x1 se jendu x2 fau lo nu binxo lo se farna be x3
column25: in x<sub>3</sub> use {lo pritu} for clockwise movement and {zunle} for counterclockwise movement.
column41: x1 turns/rotates/revolves around axis x2 in direction x3 ||| [also revolve (= jincarna)]; (cf. gunro, jendu)

column2:
'''cartu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a chart or diagram of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  showing information  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cartu''' — chart. '''lo se cartu''' — picture on a chart. 
:'''i ti cartu pa fange tcadu lo dargu''' — ''This is a map showing roads of an alien city.''
:'''i gau ko zgana fa mi lo cartu be lo nu'o se zvati be mi'o''' — ''Show me a map of a place where you and I haven't been.''
:Related words: {platu}
column16: is a chart or diagram of
column41: x1 is a chart/diagram/map of/about x2 showing formation/data-points x3 ||| (cf. platu)

column2:
'''carvi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  rains or showers to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo carvi''' — rain. '''lo te carvi''' — rain cloud. 
:'''i ca ca'o carvi''' — ''It's raining.''
:'''i lo snime pu carmi carvi le lalxu lo barda dilnu''' — ''It was snowing hard onto the lake from a large cloud.''
:Related words: {bratu}, {dilnu}, {santa}, {snime}, {tcima}, {bisli}, {bumru}
column7: x1 ru'i farlu x2 x3
column41: x1 rains/showers/[precipitates] to x2 from x3; x1 is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'] ||| (cf. bratu, dilnu, santa, snime, tcima, bisli, bumru)

column2:
'''casnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>''  discuss  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo casnu''' — debaters. '''lo se casnu''' — topic of a discussion. 
:'''i le fetsi jo'u mi pu casnu pa arte''' — ''She and I discussed a piece of art.''
:Comment: {do} {jo'u} {mi} {casnu} means @@@You and I discuss with each other@@@, {la} {alis} {jo'u} {do} {jo'u} {bo} {mi} {casnu} means @@@Alices discusses with us (you and me) (not necessarily that you and I discuss it)@@@, {do} {e} {mi} {casnu} means @@@You discuss, I discuss (not necessarily with each other, each of us might be discussing with different people)@@@.
:Related words: {bacru}, {cusku}, {darlu}, {tavla}
column3: -x1(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject x2.
column4: _+x1 discuss/talk about topic/subject x2.
column5: _-Also chat, converse. See also {bacru}, {cusku}, {darlu}, {tavla}.
column6: _+x1 is usually plural but may be a single individual. Also chat, converse. See also {bacru}, {cusku}, {darlu}, {tavla}.
column7: x1 simxu lo ka ce'u ce'u tavla x2 da
column25: {do} {jo'u} {mi} {casnu} means @@@You and I discuss with each other@@@, {la} {alis} {jo'u} {do} {jo'u} {bo} {mi} {casnu} means @@@Alices discusses with us (you and me) (not necessarily that you and I discuss it)@@@, {do} {e} {mi} {casnu} means @@@You discuss, I discuss (not necessarily with each other, each of us might be discussing with different people)@@@.
column41: x1(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject x2 ||| [also chat, converse]; (cf. bacru, cusku, darlu, tavla)

column2:
'''catke''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  shoves or pushes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''i ko catke la'e me'o so pa pa''' — ''Dial 911!''
:'''i le nixli pu catke le nanla re'o lo stedu be ri''' — ''The girl pushed the boy on his head.''
:Comment: {danre} is for non-agentive force.
:Related words: {danre}, {darxi}, {lacpu}
column7: x1 danre x2 lo ka muvdu to'o x1 .i x1 to'e lacpu x2
column25: {danre} is for non-agentive force.
column41: x1 [agent] shoves/pushes x2 at locus x3 ||| [move by pushing/shoving (= ca'ermuvgau)]; (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

column7: x1 selfa'agau lo kanla x2 te zu'e lo ka viska je zgana x2
column41: x1 looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at x2 ||| [also look through (= grecta, ravycta, bacycta); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe"]; (cf. jvinu, minra, simlu, viska, lanli, zgana, setca, viska)

column2:
'''catni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  has authority over matter  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  on the basis of  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo catni''' — someone with authority. 
:'''i mi co'a catni lo ka te cange ti vau lo ka te e'ande mi lo patfu be mi''' — ''The authority to be a farmer on this land has been given to me by my father.''
:Related words: {turni}, {tutra}, {krati}, {jaspu}, {pulji}
column7: x1 vlipa lo ka zukte ja ckaji x2 kei ji'u x3
column41: x1 has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons x2 derived on basis x3 ||| (cf. turni, tutra, krati, cmavo list ca'i, jaspu, pulji)

column2:
'''catra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  kills  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo catra''' — killer. '''lo se catra''' — killed. 
:'''i le nakni cu kakne lo ka catra se pi'o pa rokci re cipni''' — ''He can kill two birds with one stone.''
:Related words: {morsi}, {xarci}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 mrobi'o kei ta'i x3
column41: x1 (agent) kills/slaughters/murders x2 by action/method x3 ||| (cf. morsi, xarci)

column2:
'''caxno''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is shallow in direction  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  away from reference point  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo caxno''' — shallow.

:Related words: {condi}, {tordu}, {jarki}, {cinla}, {cmalu}, {jarki}, {jmifa}
column7: x1 cmalu x2 noi farna x1 boi x3 ku'o x4
column41: x1 is shallow in extent in direction/property x2 away from reference point x3 by standard x4 ||| (cf. condi, tordu, jarki, cinla, cmalu, jarki, jmifa)

column2:
'''cecla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  launches projectile or missile  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is a gun ...
:'''lo cecla''' — gun. '''lo se cecla''' — missile. 
:'''i ti cecla lo fagri''' — ''This is a fire gun.''

column7: x1 gasnu ja bapli lo nu x2 cliva x1
column41: x1 launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile x2, propelled by x3 [propellant/propulsion] ||| [also: x1 is a gun/launcher/cannon; x1 hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to x1)]; (cf. renro, danti, jakne, jbama, spoja)

column2:
'''cecmu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a community or colony of organisms  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cecmu''' — community. '''lo se cecmu''' — member of a community. 
:'''i pa cecmu be lo cipni mo'u muvdu lo bu'u tcadu''' — ''A colony of birds moved to this city.''
:Related words: {bende}, {kulnu}, {natmi}, {tcadu}, {jecta}, {girzu}
column7: x1 gunma x2 noi se kampu lo ka xabju ja se kulnu ja se cinri ma kau
column16: is a community or colony of organisms
column41: x1 is a community/colony of organisms x2 ||| (cf. bende, kulnu, natmi, tcadu, jecta, girzu)

column2:
'''cedra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is an era or age characterized by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cedra''' — era. 
:'''i lo cabna cu cedra lo nu pilno lo skami''' — ''These days are the era of using computers.''
:Related words: {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}
column16: is an era or age characterized by
column41: x1 is an era/epoch/age characterized by x2 (event/property/interval/idea) ||| (x2 interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; x2 may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); (cf. ranji, temci, citsi)

column2:
'''cenba''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  varies in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  in amount  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cenba''' — variable. 
:'''i do cenba lo ka ma kau se cpedu vau lo barda''' — ''Your demands vary to much degree.''
:Comment: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
:Related words: {cenba}, {galfi}, {stika}, {stodi}, {zasni}, {binxo}
column7: x1 binxo lo frica be x1 bei x2 se la'u x3 .i x1 zenba ja jdika x2 x3
column25: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
column41: x1 varies/changes in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni) in amount/degree x3 under conditions x4 ||| [non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change]; (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

column2:
'''censa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is holy or sacred to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo censa''' — holy. 
:'''i lo bu'u tcadu cu censa ro prenu pe vi''' — ''This city is holy to all people here.''
:Related words: {cevni}, {krici}, {latna}, {pruxi}, {lijda}, {sinma}
column41: x1 is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group x2 ||| (cf. cevni, krici, latna, pruxi, lijda, sinma)

column2:
'''centero''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is in the center of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo centero''' — center. 
:'''i ti noi tcadu cu centero le gugde''' — ''This city is in the center of the country.''
:Comment: {lo} {midju} is @@@center point@@@, {lo} {centero} is @@@central subset@@@ (of a set or territory), {lo} {kernelo} is @@@core@@@.
:Related words: {xadba}
column25: {lo} {midju} is @@@center point@@@, {lo} {centero} is @@@central subset@@@ (of a set or territory), {lo} {kernelo} is @@@core@@@.

column2:
'''centi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a hundredth of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo centi''' — 1/100_. 
:'''i le insekto cu centi be lo mitre lo ka clani''' — ''The insect is 1 centimeter long.''
:Related words: {grake}, {mitre}, {snidu}, {stero}, {delno}, {molro}, {kelvo}, {xampo}, {gradu}, {litce}, {merli}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {kilto}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}
column7: x1 klani li gei ni'u re x2
column41: x1 is a hundredth [1/100; 1x10**-2] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units) ||| (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

column2:
'''cerda''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  inherits  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x3)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  according to rule  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cerda''' — inheritor, heir. '''lo se cerda''' — inherited, heritage. 
:'''i mi cerda le dinju lo patfu be mi lo se djica be ri''' — ''I inherited the house from my father according to his will.''
:Related words: {jgina}
column7: x1 cpacu x2 x3 noi lidne x1 ku'o ja'i x4
column41: x1 is an heir to/is to inherit x2 (object/quality) from x3 according to rule x4 ||| [pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in x2) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= posycerda, posyselcerda for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. jgina)

column2:
'''cermurse''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  happens at the dawn of day  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cermurse''' — dawn. 
:'''i mi ba klama lo boske ca lo cermurse be lo bavlamdei''' — ''I will go to forest tomorrow at dawn.''
:Related words: {cerni}, {kandi}, {vanci}
column16: happens at the dawn of day

column2:
'''cerni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  happens in the morning of day  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cerni''' — morning. 
:'''i cerni coi''' — ''Good morning!''
:'''i ti cerni pa cnino djedi''' — ''It is the morning of a new day.''
:Related words: {vanci}, {cermurse}, {vacmurse}, {tcika}

column16: happens in the morning of day
column41: x1 is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day x2 at location x3 ||| [this morning (= cabdeicerni); tomorrow morning (= bavlamcerni); yesterday morning (= prulamcerni, prulamdeicerni)](cf. vanci, murse, tcika)

column2:
'''certu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is skilled at  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo certu''' — expert, master. '''lo se certu''' — field of expertise. 
:'''i fau ei ro da mi se zu'e se marvele lo nu le prenu se la'u li xo kau certu lo ka limna''' — ''I cannot but wonder at his skill in swimming.''
:Related words: {djuno}, {stati}, {kakne}
column7: x1 mutce lo ka se slabu je kakne x2
column41: x1 is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at x2 (event/activity) by standard x3 ||| [also competent, skilled]; (cf. djuno, stati, kakne)

column2:
'''cevni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a god of people or religion  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with dominion over  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cevni''' — god. 
:'''i do cevni mi lo nu carvi''' — ''You are a god of rain for me.''
:Related words: {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}
column3: -x1 is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion x2 with dominion over x3 [sphere]; x1 is divine.
column4: _+x1 is a/the god/deity of people(s) x2 with dominion over x3 [sphere].
column5: _-Also divinity; x2 religion refers to the religious community as a mass. See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.
column6: _+See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.
column7: x1 traji lo ka se sinma x2 noi krici lo du'u x1 turni ja jitro x2
column16: is a god of people or religion
column41: x1 is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion x2 with dominion over x3 [sphere]; x1 is divine ||| [also divinity; x2 religion refers to the religious community as a mass]; (cf. censa, krici, lijda, malsi)

column2:
'''cfari''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  commences, begins, or starts
:'''lo cfari''' — beginning, start. 
:'''i de'i li cy xo lo se tigni cu cfari''' — ''At what time does the performance begin?''
:Related words: {sisti}, {krasi}, {fanmo}, {mulno}
column7: lo krasi be x1 noi fasnu cu binxo lo zasti
column41: x1 [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; (intransitive verb) ||| (cf. sisti, krasi, fanmo)

column2:
'''cfika''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a work of fiction about plot or theme  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cfika''' — work of fiction. '''lo se cfika''' — plot of a work of fiction. 
:'''i la'e lu la lunra cu kusru turni li'u cfika lo logji bangu''' — '' 'The Moon is a harsh mistress' is a fiction about logical languages.''
:Related words: {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}
column7: x1 prosa ja pemci ja skina x2 noi xanri je nai fatci ku'o x3 .i x1 srana x2 noi xanri je nai fatci gi'e se finti x3
column16: is a work of fiction about plot or theme
column27: plot of a work of fiction
column41: x1 is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject x2/under convention x2 by author x3 ||| [also story, lie, untrue]; (cf. cukta, lisri, prosa, fatci, jitfa, jetnu, xanri)

column2:
'''cfila''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  is a flaw or defect in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  causing  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cfila''' — flaw. '''lo se cfila''' — flawed. 
:'''i mi se cfila lo nu lo drata cu xanka''' — ''I have my faults making other nervous.''
:Related words: {cikre}, {srera}, {fenra}, {fliba}, {prane}

column16: is a flaw or defect in
column41: x1 (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in x2 causing x3 ||| (cf. cikre, srera, fenra, fliba, prane)

column2:
'''cfine''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a wedge ...
:'''lo cfine''' — wedge.

:Related words: {tutci}
column41: x1 is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material x2 ||| (cf. tutci)

column2:
'''cfipu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  confuses, baffles observer  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cfipu''' — confusing. '''lo se cfipu''' — confused, baffled. 
:'''i zo zabna jai cfipu mi fai lo ka se smuni''' — ''To me {zabna} is confusing in meaning.''
:'''i do je'a xu se cfipu lo ka cuxna lo ka zukte ma kau''' — ''Are you really confused of deciding what to do?''

column41: x1 (event/state) confuses/baffles x2 [observer] due to [confusing] property x3 (ka) ||| (cf. pluja, cfipu, zunti)

column2:

:'''lo ciblu''' — blood.

column41: x1 is blood/vital fluid of organism x2 ||| (cf. risna, flecu)

:'''lo cicna''' — cyan (color).

:'''i mi nelci lo jungo cidja''' — ''I like Chinese food.''

column2:

:'''lo cidni''' — knee, elbow. 
:'''i lo cidni be lo tuple be mi cu se xrani''' — ''My knee is injured.''
:Related words: {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}
column7: x1 pagbu x2 gi'e se jonsi'u lo re pagbu be x2 noi mu'a galtu'e jo'u dzitu'e gi'a galbirka jo'u dzibirka
column16: is a knee, elbow, or other hinged joint of limb

:'''lo cidro''' — hydrogen.

column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable] ||| (cf. gapci, xukmi)

column2:
'''cifnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a baby, young living being of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cifnu''' — baby, young living being, infant. 
:'''i xu le cifnu xa'o jimpe lo lojbo se smusku''' — ''Does the infant understand Lojban yet?''

column2:
'''cigla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a gland secreting  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in body  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cigla''' — gland. '''lo se cigla''' — secretion of a gland. 
:'''i ti cigla lo xasne lo remna''' — ''This human gland secrets sweat.''

column41: x1 is a/the gland [body-part] secreting x2, of body x3; x2 is a secretion of x1 ||| [secretion (= selcigla)]; (cf. vikmi, xasne)

column2:
'''cikna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is awake
:'''lo cikna''' — someone awake. 
:'''i xu su'o do cikna''' — ''Is any of you awake?''
:'''i mi pu co'a clira cikna''' — ''I got up early.''
:'''i ko jai gau cikna fai mi de'i li cy bi''' — ''Wake me up at 8.''
:Related words: {sanji}, {sipna}, {tatpi}

column4: _+x1 is awake/alert/conscious.
column7: x1 na'e sipna gi'e sanji lo vanbi be x1

column2:
'''cikre''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  repairs or mends  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for use  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cikre''' — repairer. '''lo se cikre''' — repaired. 
:'''i mi cikre le spofu stizu lo ka ka'e se zutse''' — ''I repair the chair so that one can sit on it.''
:Related words: {cfila}, {spofu}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 di'a tolpo'u x3
column41: x1 repairs/mends/fixes x2 for use x3 ||| [a repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of x2, hence x3]; (cf. cfila, spofu)

column2:
'''ciksi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  explains  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with explanation  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ciksi''' — expounder. '''lo ve ciksi''' — explanation. 
:'''i mi pu ciksi fi le ctuca fe lo nu mi na zvati le nu penmi vau fo lo nu mi na pu djuno le du'u sarcu fa lo nu mi zvati nu bu''' — ''I explained to the teacher my absence at the meeting that I didn't know that I should've been there.''
:Related words: {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {retsku}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}
column7: x1 troci lo ka gasnu lo nu x2 te jimpe fi x3 kei kei lo ka skicu x2 x3 x4
column41: x1 (person) explains x2 (event/state/property) to x3 with explanation x4 (du'u) ||| [explanation x4 is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for x2 (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause]; (cf. cipra, danfu, jalge, jinvi, krinu, mukti, nabmi, preti, rinka, sidbo, zukte, tavla)

column2:

column4: _+x1 is wild/untamed.

column2:
'''cilre''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  learns some fact or information  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from doing or being  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cilre''' — learner. '''lo se cilre''' — learned. 
:'''i mi cilre fi la lojban''' — ''I learn Lojban.''
:'''i mi pu cilre le du'u lo remna na smani''' — ''I learnt that humans are not monkeys.''
:'''i mi tcidu mu'i lo nu mi cilre''' — ''I read in order to learn.''
:'''i mi so'i da pu'i cilre fo lo nu mi pu zgana lo cipni''' — ''I learned a lot from watching birds.''

column41: x1 learns x2 (du'u) about subject x3 from source x4 (obj./event) by method x5 (event/process) ||| (cf. ctuca, tadni, djuno, ckule)

'''cilta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a thread, wire, filament ...
:'''lo cilta''' — thread (cord), cord.

:'''i lo insekto cu cinki''' — ''Insects are arthropods.''

'''cinla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is thin in length/width etc.  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cinla''' — thin.

'''cinmo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  feels emotion  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

:Related words: {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {marvele}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}

column2:
'''cinri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  interests observer  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cinri''' — interesting. '''lo se cinri''' — interested. 
:'''i ma se cinri lo nu ca ma kau le fetsi co'a speni''' — ''Who cares when she gets married?''
:'''i mi se cinri lo nu xu kau sarcu fa lo nu mi cusku fi la alis fe lo se du'u mi pu zi zukte ma kau''' — ''I wonder if I should tell Alice what I just did.''

column41: x1 (abstraction) interests/is interesting to x2; x2 is interested in x1 ||| [use x1 tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= selci'i)]; (cf. zdile, kucli, manci, kurji)

column2:
'''cinta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some paint of substance  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in a base of  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cinta''' — paint (coloring substance). '''lo se cinta''' — pigment of a paint. '''lo te cinta''' — paint base. 
:'''i mi pu punji lo cinta be lo kliti bei lo sovda le bitmu''' — ''I put an oil paint (with clay as a pigment) on to the wall.''
:Comment: {lo} {te} {cinta} (paint base) is the part of the paint that is not a {lo} {se} {cinta} (pigment).

'''cinza''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a pincer, pair of chopsticks, tongs, pliers for doing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cinza''' — tongs. 
:'''i ko jgari lo cinza be lo nu jukpa bei lo glare''' — ''Take chopsticks for cooking hot food.''

:'''i le pa cipni ca'o vofli''' — ''The bird is flying.''
:Related words: {datka}, {gunse}, {jipci}, {nalci}, {pimlu}, {vofli}, {xruki}, {danlu}

column2:
'''cipra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is a test, act of examination, study of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cipra''' — study, test (act of examination). '''lo se cipra''' — tested. 
:'''i lo nu catlu lo kanla be do cu cipra lo nu do stace se la'u li xo kau''' — ''To look into your eyes is a test of your sincerity.''
:'''i mi pu gasnu lo cipra be tu'a le karce''' — ''I tested the car.''
:'''i ba zi ku mi jai se cipra''' — ''I will have a test soon.''

'''cirko''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  loses  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  at  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>''

:'''i le nu penmi pu clani lo ka se ditcu''' — ''The meeting was long.''
:'''i clani lo ka mitre li re''' — ''The length is two meters.''
:Comment: the first largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects. {clani} can be used to describe 'tall' or 'high' (in the sense of vertical length). For lengthy time intervals {barda} is also used (choice depends on personal philosophy of the speaker).
:Related words: {slabu}, {condi}, {ganra}, {rotsu}, {tordu}, {barda}, {ganra}, {gutci}, {minli}, {rotsu}
column7: x1 barda x2 noi brarai cimde x1 ku'o x3
column25: the first largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects. {clani} can be used to describe 'tall' or 'high' (in the sense of vertical length). For lengthy time intervals {barda} is also used (choice depends on personal philosophy of the speaker).
column41: x1 is long in dimension/direction x2 (default longest dimension) by measurement standard x3 ||| (cf. slabu, condi, ganra, rotsu, tordu, barda, ganra, gutci, minli, rotsu)

column2:
'''claxu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  lacks  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo claxu''' — deficient. 
:'''i mi claxu lo ka djica lo ka citka''' — ''I lack the desire to eat.''
:'''i si'au do claxu lo ka cinmo da''' — ''Looks like you lack any emotions.''
:'''i mi claxu su'o penbi''' — ''I don't have a pen.''
:Related words: {cau}, {cirko}, {kunti}, {nitcu}, {pindi}, {banzu}
column7: x1 na ckaji x2
column41: x1 is without/lacking/free of/lacks x2; x1 is x2-less ||| (cf. cmavo list cau, cirko, kunti, nitcu, pindi, banzu)

column2:
'''clika''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is lichen or moss of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>''  growing on  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo clika''' — moss. 
:'''i ti clika fi lo rokci''' — ''This is moss growing on rocks.''
:Related words: {mledi}
column3: -x1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x2 growing on x3; (adjective:) x1 is mossy.
column4: _+x1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x2 growing on x3.
column16: is lichen or moss of species
column41: x1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x2 growing on x3; (adjective:) x1 is mossy ||| (cf. mledi)

column2:
'''clira''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is early by standard  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo clira''' — early event. 
:'''i lo nu la alis cu cliva le briju pu clira lo se sruma be mi''' — ''Alice leaving the office was early according to my assumption.''
:Related words: {lerci}
column7: x1 cabna ja purci lo tolfa'o be lo tcaci ja se kanpe temci .i x1 to'e lerci
column41: x1 (event) is early by standard x2 ||| (cf. lerci)

column2:
'''clite''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is polite in matter  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' <sub>(clause)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo clite''' — polite. '''lo se clite''' — polite behaviour. 
:'''i do pu na clite lo ka cusku lo se du'u le ctuca na drani''' — ''You wasn't polite in saying that the teacher isn't right.''
:Related words: {ritli}
column41: x1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x2 according to standard/custom x3 ||| [also formal, ritual]; (cf. ritli)

column7: x1 sisti lo nu x1 zvati x2 kei fe'e ca'o x3 i x1 muvdu zi'o x2 boi x3
column41: x1 leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from x2 via route x3 ||| [also: x1 leaves behind/takes leave of x2]; (cf. litru. canci, vimcu, lebna, litru, muvdu)

column2:
'''clupa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a loop of material  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo clupa''' — loop. 
:'''i ko jai se torni le skori ja'e lo nu ri clupa''' — ''Twist the rope into a loop.''
:Related words: {djine}
column5: _-Also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}). See also {djine}.
column6: _+Also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by points (= {cuptai}). See also {djine}.
column7: x1 dasri ja skori ja cilta ja linsi x2 .i je lo fanmo be x1 cu jorne lo tolfa'o be x1
column41: x1 is a loop/circuit of x2 [material] ||| [also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= cuptai)]; (cf. djine)

column2:
'''cmaci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is mathematics describing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cmaci''' — mathematics. '''lo se cmaci''' — field of mathematics. 
:'''i mi tadni lo cmaci be lo klani''' — ''I study arithmetic (mathematics of quantity).''
:Related words: {mekso}
column7: x1 saske x2 noi se ki'irsi'u be lo namcu .a lo se klani .a lo tarmi
column41: x1 is a mathematics of type/describing x2 ||| (cf. mekso)

column2:
'''cmalu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is small in length/width etc.  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cmalu''' — small. 
:'''i lo nu penmi ba cmalu lo ka ditcu''' — ''The meeting will be short in duration.''
:'''i le cukta cu cmalu lo ka jai vajni''' — ''The book is of little importance.''
:Related words: {caxno}, {cinla}, {jarki}, {tordu}, {barda}

column41: x1 is small in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3 ||| (cf. caxno, cinla, jarki, tordu, barda)

column2:
'''cmana''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a mountain projecting from land-mass  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cmana''' — mountain. '''lo se cmana''' — land mass with a mountain. 
:'''i so'i da cmana lo bu'u tumla''' — ''This land has a lot of mountains.''
:Related words: {punli}, {derxi}
column16: is a mountain projecting from land-mass
column41: x1 is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass x2 ||| (cf. punli, derxi)

column2: #N/A

column2:
'''cmavo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a grammatical particle of class  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cmavo''' — grammatical particle. '''lo se cmavo''' — selma'o. 
:'''i zo ka cmavo ma'oi nu''' — ''{ka} is a grammatical particle of class "NU" (clause prefix)''
:Comment: {lo}, {nu}, {ui} etc. are cmavo. Usually {ma'oi} is used in x<sub>2</sub> to quote the name of selma'o (class of particles).
:Related words: {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}
column7: x1 cmima x2 noi gerna klesi gi'e stura valsi x3 .i x1 na'e brivla je na'e cmevla valsi
column16: is a grammatical particle of class
column25: {lo}, {nu}, {ui} etc. are cmavo. Usually {ma'oi} is used in x<sub>2</sub> to quote the name of selma'o (class of particles).
column41: x1 is a structure word of grammatical class x2, with meaning/function x3 in usage (language) x4 ||| [x4 may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; x3 and x4 may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste)]; (cf. gismu, lujvo, gerna, smuni, valsi)

column2:
'''cmene''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is the name for  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  used by  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cmene''' — name. '''lo te cmene''' — namegiver. 
:'''i ma jetnu cmene do''' — ''What is your real name?''
:'''i mi se cmene zo gleki''' — ''My name is Gleki.''
:'''i lo bruna be mi cu te cmene mi zo ractu''' — ''My brother calls me "Rabbit"''
:'''i le kamni pu xusra lo du'u le prenu pu zukte no se cmene be lu na'e drani li'u bei la kamni''' — ''The committee asserted that the person had done nothing "incorrect" (quoting the committee's words).''
:Comment: the first place of {cmene} requires a quote using e.g. {zo} or {lu} ... {li'u}.
:Related words: {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}
column7: x1 noi valsi ja vlapoi cu tcita x2 pi'o x3
column25: the first place of {cmene} requires a quote using e.g. {zo} or {lu} ... {li'u}.
column41: x1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x2 to/used-by namer/name-user x3 (person) ||| [also: x2 is called x1 by x3 (= selcme for reordered places)]; (cf. cmavo list me'e, gismu, tcita, valsi, judri)

column2:
'''cmevla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a cmevla (Lojban word ending in a consonant)
:'''lo cmevla''' — cmevla. 
:'''i zo lojban cmevla''' — ''"Lojban" is cmevla.''
:Comment: {lojban}, {nipon} are cmevla.
:Related words: {selbrivla}, {gismu}, {zi'evla}, {cmavo}, {cmene}

column16: is a cmevla (Lojban word ending in a consonant)
column25: {lojban}, {nipon} are cmevla.

column7: x1 jarco lo ka gleki ja se pluka ja xanka kei fau lo nu sance livbai lo vacri lo fepri lo moklu
column41: x1 laughs (emotional expression) ||| [x1 laughs at x2 (= mi'afra)]; (cf. ckasu, frumu, xajmi, cisma)

column2:
'''cmima''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a member of set  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cmima''' — member. '''lo se cmima''' — set. 
:'''i mi cmima pa kamni pe le gugde''' — ''I am a member of a state committee.''
:Comment: x<sub>1</sub> describes members of a set. To specify all members of a set use {gunma}.
:Related words: {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}
column5: _-x1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.
column6: _+x1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {menre}, {klesi}, cmavo list {me}, {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.
column7: x1 menre lo se gunma be x2 noi girzu
column25: x<sub>1</sub> describes members of a set. To specify all members of a set use {gunma}.
column41: x1 is a member/element of set x2; x1 belongs to group x2; x1 is amid/among/amongst group x2 ||| [x1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership]; (cf. ciste, porsi, jbini, girzu, gunma, klesi, cmavo list mei, kampu, lanzu, liste)

column2:
'''cmoni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  howls, utters, moans  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(sound)</sub>''  expressing  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cmoni''' — moaner. 
:'''i le prenu pu cmoni zo a lo ka gleki''' — ''The person uttered "A!" expressing his happiness.''
:Comment: {cmoni} describes emotional utterances. For uttering text use {bacru}, for shouting text use {krixa}.
:Related words: {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}
column25: {cmoni} describes emotional utterances. For uttering text use {bacru}, for shouting text use {krixa}.
column41: x1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x2 expressing x3 (property) ||| [also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow] (cf. krixa, bacru, cusku, cortu)

column2:
'''cnano''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is normal in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  among  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cnano''' — norm. 
:'''i lo ki'ogra be li ci cu cnano lo ka se junta vau lo ca zi jbena''' — ''3 kilograms is a normal weight of newborns.''
:Comment: {cnano} is the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts: {cizra}, {fadni}, {cafne}, {kampu}.
:Related words: {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}
column3: -x1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x2 (ka/ni) among x3(s) (set) by standard x4.
column4: _+x1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x2 (ka/ni) among x3 by standard x4.
column5: _-Also mean, normal, usual; (x3 specifies the complete set). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.
column6: _+Also mean, normal, usual; (x3 completely specified). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

column41: x1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x2 (ka/ni) among x3(s) (set) by standard x4 ||| [also mean, normal, usual; (x3 specifies the complete set)]; (cf. tcaci, fadni, kampu, lakne, tarti, rirci)

column2:
'''cnebo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a neck of body  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cnebo''' — neck. 
:'''i lo cnebo be lo za'u vi ninmu cu clani''' — ''These women have long necks.''
:Related words: {galxe}, {cutne}
column7: x1 pagbu lo xadni be x2 gi'e te jorne lo stedu lo cutne
column41: x1 is a/the neck [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point] ||| (cf. galxe, cutne)

column2:
'''cnemu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  rewards  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for atypical  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  with  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cnemu''' — rewarder. '''lo se cnemu''' — rewardee. '''lo te cnemu''' — reason for a reward. '''lo ve cnemu''' — reward. 
:'''i mi pu cnemu le gerku lo ka bevri lo grana vau lo ka te cpacu lo sakta le gerku''' — ''I rewarded the dog for bringing the stick by giving it sugar.''
:Related words: {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}
column5: _-Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, posyvelne'u for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.
column6: _+Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity, an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, posyvelne'u for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 zanfri x4 kei mu'i lo nu x2 zukte x3 noi se zanru ja vrude ja xamgu
column41: x1 (agent) rewards x2 [recipient] for atypical x3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x4 ||| [differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= zanyne'u), punishment, penalty, demerit (= malne'u, sfane'u); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posne'u, posyvelne'u for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. dunda, friti, jerna, jinga, jivna, pleji, sfasa, venfu, prali, dapma)

column2:
'''cnici''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is neat or orderly in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cnici''' — neat. 
:'''i le kerfa cu cnici lo ka se ganzu fi lo carmi''' — ''The hair is neat in being organized into a shining part.''
:Related words: {cunso}, {kalsa}
column7: x1 jai se morna lo pluka ja dikni ja te ganzu fai x2 .i x1 to'e kalsa x2
column41: x1 is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni) ||| (cf. cunso, kalsa)

column2:
'''cnino''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is new to observer  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in property  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cnino''' — new. 
:'''i lo pendo be mi co'a cnino mi lo ka kakne lo ka zgipli lo pipno''' — ''My friend appeared new to me in being able to play the piano.''
:'''i cnino fa no cnita be le lunra''' — ''Nothing is new under the Moon (saying).''
:Related words: {nuzba}, {slabu}, {citno}, se {djuno}
column7: lo nu x1 ckaji x3 cu pu zi co'a se sanji x2 .i x1 to'e slabu x2 x3
column41: x1 is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4; x1 is a novelty ||| (cf. nuzba, slabu, citno, se djuno)

column2:
'''cnisa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some quantity of lead metal
:'''lo cnisa''' — lead (metal). 
:'''i ra pu troci lo ka zbasu lo solji lo cnisa''' — ''He tried to make gold out of lead.''
:Related words: {jinme}, {tinci}
column7: x1 tilju je ranti je blagrusi jinme cmuxu'i gi'e se sinxa zo'oi Pb
column16: is some quantity of lead metal
column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal] ||| (cf. jinme, tinci)

column2:
'''cnita''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is directly beneath, directly below  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo cnita''' — what is beneath. '''lo se cnita''' — what is above. 
:'''i le pelji cu cnita le cukta''' — ''The paper is below the book.''
:Related words: {dizlo}, {gapru}, {galtu}, {farna}, {loldi}
column41: x1 is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from x2 in frame of reference x3 ||| [also underside, nether]; (cf. dizlo, gapru, galtu, farna, loldi)

column2:
'''cokcu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  soaks up  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  into  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cokcu''' — absorber. '''lo se cokcu''' — absorbed. 
:'''i le verba cu cokcu lo ladru lo tatru lo moklu''' — ''Children suck up milk from breast into the mouth.''
:Related words: {panje}, {sakci}, {lacpu}
column41: x1 soaks up/absorbs/sucks up x2 from x3 into x4; x1 is an absorbant ||| (cf. panje, sakci, lacpu)

column2:
'''condi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is deep in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  away from reference point  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo condi''' — deep. 
:'''i ti noi xamsi cu condi lo ka tsuku lo loldi be ce'u vau lo sefta''' — ''This sea is deep in reaching the bottom from the surface.''
:'''i e'o do bevri pa condi kabri''' — ''Please, bring a deep glass.''
:Related words: {clani}, {caxno}, {bargu}, {ganra}, {rotsu}, {barda}, {gutci}, {minli}
column7: x1 barda x2 noi farna x1 boi x3 ku'o x4
column41: x1 is deep in extent in direction/property x2 away from reference point x3 by standard x4 ||| (cf. clani, caxno, bargu, ganra, rotsu, barda, gutci, minli)

column2:
'''cortu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  feels pain at  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo cortu''' — who feels pain, person in pain. '''lo se cortu''' — location of pain. 
:'''i mi cortu lo xance''' — ''My hand hurts.''
:'''i mi cortu lo galxe be mi''' — ''I have a sore throat.''
:Comment: often the second place of x<sub>2</sub> is the same as x<sub>1</sub>.
:Related words: {cinmo}, {xrani}
column7: x1 ganse lo nu x2 noi pagbu ja diklo x1 cu gasnu lo nu x1 dunku ja to'e kufra
column25: often the second place of x<sub>2</sub> is the same as x<sub>1</sub>.
column26: who feels pain, person in pain
column41: x1 hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus x2 ||| (cf. cinmo, xrani)

column2:
'''cpacu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  acquires or gets  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se cpacu''' — acquired. 
:'''i mi ba cpacu lo grute mi''' — ''I'll get fruits for myself.''
:'''i mi ne lo xance pu te cpacu fi la kevin fe lo dakfu''' — ''I handed Kevin a knife.''
:Related words: {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}
