column41: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) x1 is aqueous/[aquatic] ||| [aquatic (= jaupli)]; (cf. lalxu, rirxe, xamsi, limna, litki, lumci, bumru, jinto)

column2:
'''djedi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  happens during  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  full days ...
:'''lo djedi''' — day (full day). '''lo se djedi''' — number of full days. 
:'''i mi volta ba zi lo djedi be li pa no''' — ''I will return in 10 days.''
:Comment: if x<sub>2</sub> is not used denotes one full day in duration
:Related words: {donri}, {detri}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {nicte}, {tcika}
column3: -x1 is x2 full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal.
column4: _+x1 is x2 full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard x3.
column7: x1 se ditcu lo nu mo'e x2 roi mulcarna fa lo plini no'u x3 .i x1 cacra li revo pi'i x2 la terdi
column25: if x<sub>2</sub> is not used denotes one full day in duration
column41: x1 is x2 full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal ||| [today (= cabdei); tomorrow (= bavlamdei); yesterday (= prulamdei)]; (cf. donri, detri, jeftu, masti, nanca, nicte, tcika)

column2:
'''djica''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  desires or wants  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause, property of x1)</sub>''  for purpose  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se djica''' — something desired. 
:'''i mi djica lo nu mi cusku lo xajmi vau lo nu do cisma''' — ''I want to tell something funny to make you smile.''
:'''i mi djica tu'a lo plise''' — ''I want apples.''
:'''i mi djica lo nu do smadi''' — ''I want you to guess.''
:Related words: {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}
column7: x1 cinmo lo ka nitcu x2 x3 .i x1 cinmo lo ka lo nu tolcau x2 cu rinka x3 noi ba se gleki ja se mansa x1
column41: x1 desires/wants/wishes x2 (event/state) for purpose x3 ||| [if desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x2 (or use lujvo = po'edji)]; (cf. taske, xagji, mukti, nitcu, nelci, pacna, prami, rigni, trina, xebni, xlura)

column2:
'''djuno''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  knows fact  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  on grounds  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se djuno''' — known fact. '''lo ve djuno''' — grounds of knowledge. 
:'''i mi djuno le du'u mi zasti vau fo le du'u mi pensi''' — ''I know that I exist since I think.''
:'''i mi djuno so'i da la lojban''' — ''I know a lot about Lojban.''
:'''i mi djuno mo'a da lo cmaci''' — ''I know too little about math.''
:Comment: @@@to be familiar with @@@ is {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {se} {cnino}, {na'e} {se} {fange}.
:Related words: {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}
column7: x1 ba'o facki fi zi'o fe lo du'u x3 zo'u me'au x2 vau noi jetnu x4
column25: @@@to be familiar with @@@ is {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {se} {cnino}, {na'e} {se} {fange}.
column41: x1 knows fact(s) x2 (du'u) about subject x3 by epistemology x4 ||| [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= tadjyju'o)] (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

column2:
'''donri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  happens during daytime of day  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo donri''' — day (daylight time), daytime. 
:'''i ca lo donri be lo prulamdei ra pu stali lo zdani''' — ''Yesterday in the daytime, he stayed at home.''
:Related words: {nicte}, {djedi}, {tcika}
column3: -x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
column4: _+x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3.
column7: x1 solri se gusni pagbu x2 noi djedi ku'o gi'e temci lo solnuntolcanci lo solnuncanci gi'e se stuzi x3 .i x1 to'e nicte x2 x3
column41: x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal) ||| (cf. nicte, djedi, tcika)

column2:
'''draci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a drama or play about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo draci''' — play (drama). '''lo se draci''' — plot of a drama. 
:'''i pa pendo be mi cu finti pa draci be lo nabmi pe lo te seksi''' — ''My friend is the author of a drama about the problem of sexes.''
:Related words: {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}
column16: is a drama or play about
column41: x1 is a drama/play about x2 [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist x3 for audience x4 with actors x5 ||| [x2 may also be a convention] (cf. finti, cukta, lisri, cfika)

column2:
'''drani''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is correct in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo drani''' — correct. 
:'''i do drani lo ka pilno ma kau noi valsi''' — ''You are correct in what words you use.''
:Related words: {srera}, {mapti}
column7: x1 mapti lo fatci ja jetnu x2 .i x1 to'e srera x2
column41: x1 is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect x2 (ka) in situation x3 by standard x4 ||| (cf. srera, mapti)

column2:
'''drata''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is not the same as  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo drata''' — different, another, other. 
:'''i lo drata be mi ka'e sidju''' — ''Someone else but me can help.''
:Related words: {mintu}, {frica}, {dunli}
column7: x1 frica x2 lo ka ce'u du makau ma'i x3 i x1 to'e mintu x2 boi x3
column41: x1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x2 by standard x3; x1 is something else ||| (cf. mintu, frica)

column2:
'''drudi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a roof or lid of structure  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo drudi''' — lid. '''lo se drudi''' — something with a lid. 
:'''i lo drudi be le dinju cu ei se cikre''' — ''The roof of the building needs fixing.''
:Comment: {lo} {drudi} is designed to be over, above {lo} {se} {drudi} and shelters it from other things above {lo} {drudi}.
:Related words: {bitmu}, {stedu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {loldi}, {marbi}, {gacri}, {mapku}
column7: x1 gacri je gapru je pagbu x2
column16: is a roof or lid of structure
column25: {lo} {drudi} is designed to be over, above {lo} {se} {drudi} and shelters it from other things above {lo} {drudi}.
column41: x1 is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of x2 ||| (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

column2:
'''du''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ,  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ,  ''x<sub>3</sub> are the same thing
:'''lo du''' — identically equal. 
:'''i li pa su'i pa du li re li pa no fe'i mu''' — ''1 + 1 = 2 = 10 / 5.''
:'''i xu do du lo prenu poi mitysisku mi ca lo prulamdei''' — ''Are you the same person who searched for me yesterday?''
:Comment: corresponds to the operator @@@=@@@ in math, can have any number of places.
:Related words: {bitmu}, {stedu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {loldi}, {marbi}, {gacri}, {mapku}
column7: lu'e x1 mintu lu'e x2 le ka ce'u sinxa makau
column25: corresponds to the operator @@@=@@@ in math, can have any number of places.
column37: be (to be equal, the same as) [to], equal to [to be]
column41: identity selbri; = sign; x1 identically equals x2, x3, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing ||| [It is very un-Lojbanic to translate the generic English copula 'is' by this word]; (cf. mintu)

column2:
'''dugri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  is the logarithm of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  to base  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(number)</sub>'' 
:'''lo dugri''' — logarithm. '''lo te dugri''' — base of a logarithm. 
:'''i li ci dugri li pa no no no li pa no''' — ''3 is the logarithm of 1000 to base 10.''
:Related words: {tenfa}
column7: x2 tenfa x3 boi x1 .i x1 nu'a de'o x2 boi x3
column41: x1 is the logarithm of x2 with base x3 ||| (cf. tenfa)

column2:
'''dukti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is opposite or contrary to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2 with {kau})</sub>'' 
:'''lo dukti''' — opposite. 
:'''i la alis la kevin pu dukti lo ka catlu ma kau''' — ''Alice and Kevin looked in the opposite directions.''
:Related words: {ranxi}, {ragve}
column7: x1 bancu fi x2 fe lo nutli be x3 x3
column34: property of x1 and x2 with {kau}
column41: x1 is polar opposite from/contrary to x2 in property/on scale x3 (property/si'o) ||| (cf. ranxi, ragve, fatne)

column2:
'''dunda''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  gives or donates  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo dunda''' — giver. '''lo se dunda''' — gift, present. '''lo te dunda''' — receiver of a gift. 
:'''i mi pu dunda tu'a pa plise do''' — ''I gave you an apple.''
:Comment: {lo} {se} {dunda} doesn't need to be only ''special present''.
:Related words: {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}
column5: _-Also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, posyseldu'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.
column6: _+Also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity, an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, posyseldu'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.
column7: x1 noi tolcau x2 cu gasnu lo nu x3 co'a tolcau x2
column25: {lo} {se} {dunda} doesn't need to be only ''special present''.
column41: x1 [donor] gives/donates gift/present x2 to recipient/beneficiary x3 [without payment/exchange] ||| [also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydu'a, posyseldu'a for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. benji, muvdu, canja, pleji, vecnu, friti, sfasa, dapma, cnemu, prali)

column7: x1 noi litki cu binxo lo sligu
column41: x1 freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature x2 and pressure x3 ||| (cf. febvi, lunsa, runme, sligu)

column2:
'''dunku''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is distressed or anguished by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo dunku''' — distressed. '''lo se dunku''' — distressing event. 
:'''i mi pu dunku lo ka kansa no da''' — ''I was distressed at being alone.''
:'''i xu do dunku lo nu lo mensi be do cu bilma''' — ''Are you distressed at your sister being ill?''
:Related words: {fengu}, {surla}
column7: x1 mutce lo ka xanka ja badri x2
column41: x1 is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by x2 ||| (cf. fengu, surla)

column2:
'''dunli''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is equal to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2 with {kau})</sub>''  ...
:'''lo dunli''' — equal. 
:'''i mi dunli lo mensi be mi lo ka clani i ku'i mi na mintu le mensi''' — ''I am as long as my sister is. But I'm not her.''
:'''i mi dunli do lo ka jinvi ma kau lo se zukte be le prenu''' — ''I am in concord with you in what we think about his actions.''
:Related words: {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}
column7: ro da zo'u x1 .o x2 da ckini x3
column34: property of x1 and x2 with {kau}
column41: x1 is equal/congruent to/as much as x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3 ||| [same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka x1 simsa x2) and (ka x3 simsa x4)]; (cf. cmavo list du'i, satci, frica, simsa, mintu)

column2:
'''dunra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is winter of year  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  at location  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo dunra''' — winter. 
:'''i ca lo dunra be lo re no no mu moi bei la australiias mi pu zvati ti''' — ''During Australian winter of year 2005 I was here.''
:Related words: {citsi}, {crisa}, {critu}, {vensa}
column7: x1 citsi lo ka lenku kei x2 tu'i x3 gi'e se lidne lo critu gi'e lidne lo vensa
column41: x1 is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year x2 at location x3 ||| (cf. citsi, crisa, critu, vensa)

column2:
'''dzena''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an elder or ancestor of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by bond  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo dzena''' — ancestor. '''lo se dzena''' — descendant. 
:'''i do dzena mi lo ka ce'u ce'u lidne lo ka jbena ca ma kau''' — ''You are my ancestor since you were born before me.''
:Related words: {patfu}, {rirni}, {tamne}
column7: x1 mutce lidne x2 x3 noi mu'a lo ka rorci .i lo rorlei be x1 cu purci lo rorlei be lo rorci be x2
column16: is an elder or ancestor of
column41: x1 is an elder/ancestor of x2 by bond/tie/degree x3; x1's generation precedes x2's parents ||| (cf. patfu, rirni, tamne)
x1 reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2 ||| (cf. ketco, friko, sralo, terdi)

column2:
'''enge''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an architect/designer/engineer of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo enge''' — designer. 
:'''i lo patfu be mi pu enge ti noi dinju''' — ''My father was an architect of this building.''
:Related words: {zbasu}, {platu}

'''entuzi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is enthusiastic, excited about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause, property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo entuzi''' — enthusiastic. 
:'''i la kevin cu mutce lo ka entuzi lo ka co'a se jibri lo cnino''' — ''Kevin is very enthusiastic about getting a new job.''
:Comment: {carmi} {akti} is for the meaning @@@excited (in high energy state)@@@.
:Related words: {xanka}, {carmi}, {akti}
column25: {carmi} {akti} is for the meaning @@@excited (in high energy state)@@@.

column2:
'''esporte''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a type of sports practiced by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo esporte''' — sports. '''lo se esporte''' — sportsperson, sportsman, sportswoman. 
:'''i mi se esporte la tenis''' — ''I practice tennis.''
:Related words: {zajba}, {sluji}, {dansu}
column16: is a type of sports practiced by

column2:
'''facki''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  discovers fact  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> finds out that x<sub>2</sub> is true
:'''lo facki''' — discoverer. '''lo se facki''' — discovery. 
:'''i mi facki lo jitfa lo pu se cusku be la alis''' — ''I discovered false statements in what Alice said.''
:'''i mi facki le du'u le tcadu cu jibni''' — ''I found that the city is near.''
:'''i mi pu facki le du'u le lisri cu xajmi''' — ''I found the story funny.''
:Comment: for searching for objects and finding them use {mitysisku} and {zvafa'i}.
:Related words: {cirko}, {djuno}, {jijnu}, {smadi}, {sisku}
column7: x1 co'a djuno x2 boi x3 .i x1 binxo lo djuno be x2 bei x3 .i cfari fa lo nu x1 djuno x2 boi x3
column24: x<sub>1</sub> finds out that x<sub>2</sub> is true
column25: for searching for objects and finding them use {mitysisku} and {zvafa'i}.
column41: x1 discovers/finds out x2 (du'u) about subject/object x3; x1 finds (fi) x3 (object) ||| (cf. cirko, djuno, jijnu, smadi, sisku)

column2:
'''fadni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is ordinary in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  among  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fadni''' — typical, ordinary. 
:'''i fi lo pendo be mi cu fadni fa la kevin lo ka cusku lo simsa noi srana mi''' — ''Among my friends, it's common for Kevin to say such things about me.''
:Related words: {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}
column3: -x1 [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set).
column4: _+x1 is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x2 (ka) among x3.
column5: _-Also: x2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set x3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; (x3 is complete set). See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.
column6: _+Also: x2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among x3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar. See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.
column7: x1 ckaji x2 gi'e cmima x3 noi se cmima so'i ckaji be x2 .i x1 to'e rirci x2 x3
column41: x1 [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set) ||| [also: x2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set x3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; (x3 is complete set)]; (cf. cafne, rirci, kampu, lakne, tcaci, cnano)

column2:
'''fagri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fire in fuel  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  burning in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity: 'oxygen' by default)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fagri''' — fire. '''lo se fagri''' — fuel for fire. '''lo te fagri''' — oxidizer of fire. 
:'''i lo fagri be le boske bei lo brife co'a carmi''' — ''The fire in the forest burning in the wind becomes intense.''
:'''i le mudri cu se fagri''' — ''The wood is burning.''
:Related words: {jelca}, {sacki}
column7: x1 nu x2 jelca x3 ja'e lo nu dirce lo gusni jo'u lo glare jo'u lo jelca gapci
column41: x1 is a fire/flame in fuel x2 burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer x3 (default air/oxygen) ||| (cf. jelca, sacki)

column2:
'''falnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a sail for gathering wind  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  on vehicle  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo falnu''' — sail. '''lo se falnu''' — wind for a sail. '''lo te falnu''' — sailboat. 
:'''i ti noi bloti cu te falnu''' — ''This is a sailboat.''
:'''i ti noi molki cu te falnu lo djacu pa xislu''' — ''This mill operates on a water wheel.''
:Comment: x<sub>2</sub> can be wind, water or other forces enabling the sail to work.
:Related words: {bloti}
column7: x1 bukpu ja balre tutci lo ka se danre x2 noi brife ja flecu ku'o gi'e benji lo bapli x3 noi marce ja matra
column16: is a sail for gathering wind
column25: x<sub>2</sub> can be wind, water or other forces enabling the sail to work.
column41: x1 is a sail for gathering propelling material x2 on vehicle/motor x3 ||| [waterwheel (= jacfanxi'u)]; (cf. bloti)

column2:
'''famti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an aunt or uncle of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by bond  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo famti''' — aunt, uncle. '''lo se famti''' — niece, nephew. 
:'''i do famti mi lo ka ce'u mensi lo mamta be ce'u''' — ''You are my aunt since you are a sister of my mother.''
:Related words: {bruna}, {mamta}, {mensi}, {patfu}, {rirni}, {tamne}
column7: x1 dunli x2 lo ka makau lanzu ce'u x3 kei gi'e lidne x2 lo ka ce'u cmima lo xokaumoi rorlei
column16: is an aunt or uncle of
column41: x1 is an aunt/uncle of x2 by bond/tie x3; x1 is an associated member of x2's parent's generation ||| (cf. bruna, mamta, mensi, patfu, rirni, tamne)

column2:
'''lacri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  relies, counts on, trusts  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  to bring about, ensure, maintain state  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 with {kau})</sub>'' 
:'''i mi lacri do lo ka ma kau sidju''' — ''I rely on you to help me.''
:'''i mi xebni lo ka lacri lo karce pe mi lo ka klama lo jai se djica be mi fu ma kau''' — ''I hate having to rely on my car to get where I want.''
:Related words: {minde}, {nitcu}, {tinbe}
column18: to bring about, ensure, maintain state
column41: x1 relies/depends/counts on/trusts x2 to bring about/ensure/maintain x3 (event/state) ||| (cf. minde, nitcu, tinbe)

column2:
'''fancu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a function mapping argument domain  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  to function range ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  defined by rule  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(text)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is a function of x<sub>2</sub>
:'''lo fancu''' — function. '''lo se fancu''' — domain of function arguments. '''lo te fancu''' — range of function. 
:'''i lo nu se la'u li xo kau mi'o snada cu te fancu lo nu se la'u li xo kau mi'o troci''' — ''Our success depends on how hard we try.''
:'''i lo jdima be lo broda cu te fancu lo nu le broda tai ma kau cu se sabji jo'u lo nu le broda cu se cpedu xo kau da''' — ''The price of a good is a function of its supply and demand.''
:'''i lo nu mi jimpe la'e ti na te fancu tu'a do''' — ''I don't depend on you to understand this.''
:'''i li fy pe li xy cu fancu li ma'u li ma'u no me'o vei xy su'i pa ve'o pi'i vei xy vu'u pa ve'o''' — ''f(x) = (x + 1) (x − 1), where x>1, f(x)>0.''
:Related words: {mekso}, {bridi}
column7: x1 jai jalge fai lo ka du ma kau kei lo du'u x2 du ma kau
column16: is a function mapping argument domain
column24: x<sub>1</sub> is a function of x<sub>2</sub>
column41: x1 is a function/single-valued mapping from domain x2 to range x3 defined by expression/rule x4 ||| (cf. mekso, bridi)

column2:
'''fange''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is alien or unfamiliar to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fange''' — alien, unfamiliar. 
:'''i ra fange mi lo ka zukte ma kau''' — ''He is alien to me in what he does.''
:Related words: {cizra}, {jbena}, {ckini}
column7: x1 frica lo se tcaci be x2 x3
column41: x1 is alien/foreign/[exotic]/unfamiliar to x2 in property x3 (ka) ||| (cf. cizra, jbena, ckini)

column2:
'''fanmo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is the final, last part leading up to completion of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fanmo''' — finish, finale, final part, end (ending). '''lo se fanmo''' — process being finished. 
:'''i do te mukti lo ka mo ca lo fanmo lo ca jeftu''' — ''What are you going to do on weekend?''
:'''i lo fanmo be le te jivna ba cinri ba'a''' — ''I expect the final part of the competition interesting.''
:Comment: can refer to place.
:Related words: {cfari}, {sisti}, {krasi}, {mulno}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {traji}
column7: x1 pagbu ja se farvi x2 gi'e balvi ja jersi ja se lidne ro drata pagbu be x2 .i x1 to'e krasi x2
column16: is the final, last part leading up to completion of
column25: can refer to place.
column41: x1 is an end/finish/termination of thing/process x2; [not necessarily implying completeness] ||| [x1 is final/last/at the last; x1 is a terminal/terminus of x2; x1 is the final/terminated state of terminated process x2; x2 terminates/ceases/stops/halts at x1 (= selfa'o for reordered places)]; (cf. krasi, cfari, mulno, sisti, denpa, jipno, kojna, traji, krasi)

column2:
'''fanri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a factory or mill producing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fanri''' — factory, mill. '''lo se fanri''' — product of a factory. '''lo te fanri''' — raw material for a factory. 
:'''i ti fanri lo nanba lo gurni''' — ''This is a mill producing bread from grain.''
:Related words: {molki}, {gundi}
column7: x1 dinju lo gundi be x2 noi se zbasu fi x3
column16: is a factory or mill producing
column41: x1 is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing x2 from materials x3 ||| (cf. molki, gundi)

column2:
'''fanta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  prevents  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  from occurring
:'''lo se fanta''' — event being prevented. 
:'''i lo bumru pu fanta lo nu mi'a viska da''' — ''Fog prevented us from seeing anything.''
:Related words: {pinfu}, {bandu}, {zunti}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {bapli}, {rivbi}
column7: x1 bapli lo nu x2 na fasnu
column41: x1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x2 from occurring ||| (cf. pinfu, bandu, zunti, rinju, jimte, bapli, rivbi)

column2:
'''fanva''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  translates  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  to language  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from language  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with result  ''x<sub>5</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''
:'''lo fanva''' — translator. '''lo se fanva''' — text to be translated. '''lo te fanva''' — target language for translation. '''lo ve fanva''' — source language for translation. '''lo xe fanva''' — translation (text). 
:'''i mi pu fanva lu coi ui li'u lo glico lo lojbo zoi gy.yay, hello!.gy.''' — ''I translated {coi ui} to English from Lojban as "Yay, hello!"''
:'''i xu lu coi do li'u drani xe fanva zoi gy.Hello, you!.gy.''' — ''Is {coi do} a correct translation of "Hello, you!"?''
:Comment: {traduki} is an alternative to {fanva}.
:Related words: {cusku}, {bangu}, {traduki}
column7: x1 finti lo no'u x5 poi'i bausmu ke'a x3 fo x1 fa lo bausmu be x2 bei x4 bei x1 kei da
column25: {traduki} is an alternative to {fanva}.
column41: x1 translates text/utterance x2 to language x3 from language x4 with translation result x5 ||| (cf. cusku, bangu)

column2:
'''fanza''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  annoys  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fanza''' — annoying event. '''lo se fanza''' — annoyed person. 
:'''i lo nu lo verba cu klaku cu fanza lo mamta be le verba''' — ''Baby crying annoys his mother.''
:'''i do fanza mi''' — ''You annoy me.''
:Related words: {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 milxe lo ka fengu ja se raktu ja to'e se pluka
column41: x1 (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts x2 ||| [also: is disruptive to]; (cf. fengu, raktu, dicra, tunta, zunti, jicla)

column2:
'''fapro''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  opposes, doesn't surrender to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> refuses to do x<sub>3</sub>
:'''i mi pu fliba lo ka fapro lo nu do cisma''' — ''I couldn't resist your smile.''
:'''i xu do fapro fi lo ka sidju mi''' — ''Do you refuse to help me?''
:Related words: {bandu}, {bradi}, {darlu}, {damba}, {jivna}, {lanxe}, {rivbi}, {sarji}, {xarnu}
column3: -x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force ind./mass) about x3 (abstract).
column4: _+x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force) about x3 (abstract).
column7: x1 dukti x2 lo ka ce'u zukte ja ckaji ma kau se ra'a x3 .i x1 to'e kansa ja jivna ja damba ja bradi ja jamna x2 x3
column41: x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force ind./mass) about x3 (abstract) ||| [also resists]; (cf. bandu, bradi, darlu, damba, jivna, lanxe, rivbi, sarji, xarnu)

column2:
'''tolpro''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  surrenders, yields to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> consents to do x<sub>3</sub>
:'''i mi pu tolpro lo pendo lo ka klama lo dinju be lo nu skina''' — ''I accepted my friend's proposal to go to the cinema.''
:Comment: {tugni} is @@@to agree with some statement@@@, {tolpro} is @@@to accept something and actually do it@@@.
:Related words: {fapro}, {tugni}, {i'a}, {vi'o}, {bradi}, {darlu}, {damba}, {lanxe}
column25: {tugni} is @@@to agree with some statement@@@, {tolpro} is @@@to accept something and actually do it@@@.
? remove this gismu. fapro?

column2:
'''farlu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  falls to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''i mi pu farlu fi pa skalera fe lo dertu''' — ''I fell down from the stairs onto the ground.''
:'''i la alis pu jai gau farlu fai le dakli le jubme''' — ''Alice dropped the bag on the table.''
:Related words: {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}
column7: x1 muvdu x2 x3 noi galmau x2 ku'o se ja'e lo nu lo terdi cu lacpu x1
column41: x1 falls/drops to x2 from x3 in gravity well/frame of reference x4 ||| [note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a)] (cf. lafti, cpare, klama, sfubu)

column2:
'''farna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the direction of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from origin  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo farna''' — direction, trend. 
:'''i le canko cu farna lo nu la alis pu catlu vau mi''' — ''From my viewpoint, Alice was looking at the direction of the window.''
:Related words: {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}
column7: x1 se crane ja se muvdu x2 gi'e se sirji lo vasru ja se zvati be x2 x3
column41: x1 is the direction of x2 (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference x3 ||| [x2 is towards x1 from x3 (= selfa'a for reordered places)]; (cf. zunle, pritu, galtu, gapru, cnita, dizlo, berti, snanu, stuna, stici, purci, balvi, lidne)

column2:
'''farvi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  evolves or develops into  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  through stages  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(ordered entity group)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ve farvi''' — stage of development, version in development. 
:'''i lo'e nanba cu farvi lo bredi lo te zbasu lo nu co'a mixre lo purmo jo'u lo matne jo'u lo sovda jo'u lo sakta vau jo'u ba bo lo nu glare jo'u ba bo lo nu satre vo'a lo matne''' — ''One makes a standard cake from raw materials by mixing flour, butter, eggs and sugar together, then heating, then greasing the cake with butter, and after that, it is ready.''
:Related words: {pruce}, {banro}, {makcu}, {ciste}, {cupra}, {ferti}
column7: x1 cenba co'u lo nu x1 du x2 kei co'a lo nu x1 du x3 kei ca'o lo nu x1 du x4
column29: stage of development, version in development
column41: x1 develops/evolves towards/into x2 from x3 through stages x4 ||| (cf. pruce, banro, makcu, ciste, cupra, ferti)

column2:
'''fasnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  occurs or happens
:'''lo fasnu''' — occurrence, case (occurrence). 
:'''i lo cizra pu va fasnu''' — ''There were strange things happening there.''
:'''i lo ei ba fasnu ba fasnu''' — ''Whatever shall be will be.''
:Related words: {fau}, {krefu}, {lifri}, {fatci}, {rapli}, {gasnu}, {zukte}, {banli}
column7: x1 co'a je ca'o je co'u zasti .i x1 ca'o zasti .i x1 co'i zasti
column41: x1 (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; x1 is an incident/happening/occurrence ||| (cf. cmavo list fau, krefu, lifri, fatci, rapli; gasnu, zukte, if specifically agentive, banli)

column2:
'''fatci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is a fact
:'''lo fatci''' — fact, factual. 
:'''i mi se la'u li me'i ro birti le du'u ro se djuno be mi bei le munje cu fatci''' — ''I'm not completely sure that all that I know about the world are actual facts.''
:Related words: {datni}, {jitfa}, {xanri}, {jetnu}, {fasnu}, {zasti}, {cfika}, {saske}
column7: x1 zasti lo na'e xanri
column41: x1 (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute ||| (cf. datni, jitfa, sucta, xanri, jetnu, fasnu, zasti, cfika, saske)

column25: no fatne3. use dukti.

column2:
'''fatri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is distributed among  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with portions  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fatri''' — distributed. '''lo te fatri''' — portion of a distributed thing. 
:'''i gau mi fatri fa lo titla lo verba lo pa mei''' — ''I handed out candies to children one candy to each of them.''
:Related words: {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}
column7: x1 se menre ja gunma ja se spisa lo se me x2 moi be x3
column41: x1 is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x2 with shares/portions x3; (x2/x3 fa'u) ||| [also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= fairgau, fairzu'e)]; (cf. cmavo list fa'u, fendi, preja, katna, tcana)

column2:
'''febvi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  evaporates, boils ...
:'''lo febvi''' — something boiling. 
:'''i le djacu za'o febvi''' — ''The water is already boiling.''
:Related words: {dunja}, {lunsa}, {litki}
column7: x1 noi litki cu binxo lo gapci
column41: x1 boils/evaporates at temperature x2 and pressure x3 ||| [roil (= febjicla)]; (cf. dunja, lunsa, runme)

column2:
'''fegli''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is ugly to observer  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in aspect  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fegli''' — something ugly. 
:'''i le djacu cu fegli lo ka se panci ma kau''' — ''The water has an ugly smell.''
:Related words: {rigni}, {melbi}, {pluka}

column7: x1 klani li gei ni'u pa mu x2
column41: x1 is 1x10**-15 of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units) ||| (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

column2:
'''fendi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  divides  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  into  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo fendi''' — divider. '''lo se fendi''' — divided. 
:'''i mi fendi le najnimre ci spisa''' — ''I divide the orange into three pieces.''
:Related words: {sepli}, {bitmu}, {fatri}, {dilcu}, {katna}, {frinu}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 noi pa mei ja gunma ja kansi'u ja jonsi'u cu binxo x3 noi sepsi'u x4
column41: x1 (agent) divides/partitions/separates x2 into sections/parts/ind. x3 by method/partition x4 ||| [also segments]; (cf. sepli, bitmu, fatri, dilcu, katna, frinu)

column2:
'''fengu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is angry with  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fengu''' — angry. 
:'''i ra pu fengu mi lo ka pu na klama''' — ''She was angry with me for not coming.''
:Related words: {fanza}, {dunku}

column41: x1 is angry/mad at x2 for x3 (action/state/property) ||| (cf. fanza, dunku)

column2:
'''fenki''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is crazy ...
:'''lo fenki''' — crazy action. 
:'''i le tcini cu fenki''' — ''The situation is crazy.''
:'''i lo ka fengu cu klesi lo ka jai fenki''' — ''Anger is a form of madness.''
:Related words: {bebna}, {racli}, {xajmi}

column41: x1 (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard x2 ||| (cf. bebna, racli, xajmi)

:'''i da fenra le bitmu''' — ''There is a crack in the wall.''
:Related words: {kevna}, {cfila}, {jinto}
column41: x1 is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in x2 ||| (cf. kevna, cfila, jinto)

column2:
'''fepni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  cents/copecks in value in monetary system  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...

:Comment: describes money subunits like cents, kopecks.
:Related words: {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}

column18: cents/copecks in value in monetary system
column25: describes money subunits like cents, kopecks.
column41: x1 is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as x2 [quantity], in monetary system x3 ||| [also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; x1 is generally a price/cost/value]; (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as x4, x5, x6, ...); (cf. sicni, jdini, jdima, vecnu, rupnu, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, bunda, kramu)

column2:
'''fepri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the lung of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fepri''' — lung. 
:'''i ro da pu sanga se rai lo ka pilno lo fepri be vo'a''' — ''Everybody sang at the top of their lungs.''
:Related words: {pambe}, {vasxu}
column5: _-Also (adjective:) x1 is pulmonary. See also {pambe}, {vasxu}.
column6: _+See also {pambe}, {vasxu}.
column41: x1 is a/the lung [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows] ||| [also (adjective:) x1 is pulmonary]; (cf. pambe, vasxu)

column2:
'''ferti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is fertile for growing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ferti''' — fertile. 
:'''i lo vi tumla cu ferti lo ka te crepu lo vanjba''' — ''This land is fertile for reaping grapes.''
:'''i ti noi fetsi cu ferti lo ka se tarbi''' — ''This female is fertile for conception.''
:Comment: covers both potential and actual/realized fertility.
:Related words: {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}
column7: .i lo si'o ce'u goi x1 ferti ce'u goi x2 cu si'o ce'u goi x1 kakne lo ka ce'u jai si'u farvi fai ce'uxire goi x2 kei zo'e
column25: covers both potential and actual/realized fertility.
column41: x1 is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of x2; x1 is fruitful/prolific ||| [also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility)]; (cf. vanbi, sidju, rorci, farvi, banro, cange)

column2:
'''festi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is waste from  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo festi''' — waste. 
:'''i ko bevri lo festi be lo grute lo klaji''' — ''Take the fruit scraps to the street.''
:Related words: {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}
column7: x1 na'e se djica ja na'e se nitcu te pruce fi x2
column41: x1(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by x2 (event/activity) ||| [also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= fesygau, fesyzu'e)]; (cf. xaksu, kalci, pinca)

column2:
'''fetsi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a female of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>''  with feminine traits  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fetsi''' — female. '''lo te fetsi''' — feminine trait. 
:'''i ti fetsi lo finpe lo ka se ganti ma kau''' — ''This fish is female in having a certain kind of gonads.''
:Related words: {nakni}
column41: x1 is a female/doe of species x2 evidencing feminine trait(s) x3 (ka); x1 is feminine ||| (cf. nakni)

column2:
'''figre''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fig of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo figre''' — fig. 
:'''i mi nelci ti noi crino figre''' — ''I like these green figs.''
:Related words: {grute}
column41: x1 is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain x2 ||| (cf. grute)

column2:
'''skina''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a video clip, movie about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo skina''' — movie, film, video clip. '''lo se skina''' — plot of a movie. 
:'''i mi pu zgana pa skina be lo crida''' — ''I watched a movie about magical beings.''
:Comment: can be applied to streaming video.
:Related words: {tivni}, {vidni}, {pixra}, {finti}
column7: x1 jvinu je sance vreji x2 gi'e se finti x3 lo nu x4 zgana
column16: is a video clip, movie about
column25: can be applied to streaming video.
column41: x1 is a cinema/movie/film about x2 [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker x3, for audience x4 ||| [also motion picture; x2 may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a skina); television/tv show (= tivyskina, regardless of length, factual content, etc.)]; (cf. tivni, vidni, pixra, finti)

column2:
'''finpe''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fish of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo finpe''' — fish. 
:'''i mi se pluka lo ka kalte lo finpe''' — ''I like fishing.''
:Related words: {danlu}
column7: x1 lekselblu je jaurxa'u bogda'u x2
column41: x1 is a fish of species x2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates] ||| (cf. danlu)

column2:
'''finti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  invents or creates  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for purpose  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from existing elements or ideas  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo finti''' — creator. '''lo se finti''' — creation (object created), creature. '''lo te finti''' — purpose of creation. '''lo ve finti''' — raw materials for creation. 
:'''i mi pu finti pa lisri lo ka jai gau zdile le verba vau lo se vedli be mi''' — ''I created a story out of my real experience to amuse the child.''
:Related words: {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, {prosa}, {skina}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 zasti gi'e tutci x3 .i x1 zbasu x2 gi'e kanpe lo nu x2 ba se pilno fi x3
column41: x1 invents/creates/composes/authors x2 for function/purpose x3 from existing elements/ideas x4 ||| [x1 is creative/inventive]; (cf. cmavo list fi'e, ciska, pemci, zbasu, larcu, specific works of authorship, prosa, skina)

column2:
'''flalu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a law specifying  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  for community  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo flalu''' — law. 
:'''i lo flalu be lo ka na ralte lo gerku bei ro se zdani cu cizra''' — ''The law specifying that no citizen should keep a dog is crazy.''
:Comment: x<sub>1</sub> is the name of the law.
:Related words: {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}
column7: x1 javni lo nu x2 se zukte ja se ckaji x3 kei x4
column25: x<sub>1</sub> is the name of the law.
column41: x1 is a law specifying x2 (state/event) for community x3 under conditions x4 by lawgiver(s) x5 ||| [x1 is a legality; x2 is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= selfla for reordered places)]; (cf. javni, ritli, zekri, pulji, tinbe)

column2:
'''flani''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a flute, fife
:'''lo flani''' — flute. 
:'''i lo sance be le flani cu jai pluka''' — ''The flute has a pleasant sound.''
:Related words: {zgike}
column41: x1 is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument] ||| (cf. zgike)

column2:
'''flecu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a current in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  flowing towards  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo flecu''' — current (flow), flow (current). 
:'''i ti flecu lo condi pa lalxu pa galtu krasi pe bu'u loi cmana''' — ''This is a current in a deep bed running towards a lake from high springheads in the mountains.''
:Comment: {flu'ente} that has a place structure identical to {muvdu}.
column7: x1 marji x2 noi litki ja gapci gi'e muvdu x3 x4 lo ru'i vasru be x2
column25: {flu'ente} that has a place structure identical to {muvdu}.
column41: x1 is a current/flow/river of/in x2 flowing in direction to/towards x3 from direction/source x4 ||| [x1 is a stream of x2; x2 is a fluid [gas or liquid] (= selfle for reordered places); x1 flushes toward x3; flush (= caifle, sukfle)]; (cf. rirxe, senta where no directionality is implied, rinci, xampo, dikca, sakci, gapci, litki, ciblu)

column2:
'''fliba''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  fails at doing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''i mi za'u re'u fliba le cipra''' — ''I failed the test again.''
:'''i le se troci pu se fliba''' — ''The attempt failed.''
:'''i mi fliba lo ka zvafa'i le penbi''' — ''I can't find the pen.''
:Related words: {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}
column7: x1 na mulzu'e x2 noi se troci x1 .i x1 to'e snada x2
column41: x1 fails at doing x2 (state/event); x1 is a failure at its role in x2 ||| [baffled (= pesfli, jmifli, dafspufli, menfli, among other senses); also x2 ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of x1]; (cf. cfila, snada, srera, troci, sisti, ranji, denpa, bebna, zunti)

column2:
'''flira''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a face of body  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo flira''' — face. 
:'''i u'e melbi flira ra''' — ''What a nice face she has!''
:'''i ra pu minde mi lo ka lumci lo flira be mi''' — ''He told me to wash my face.''
:Related words: {sefta}, {stedu}, {crane}, {mebri}
column3: -x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2; (adjective:) x1 is facial.
column4: _+x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2.
column7: x1 crane pagbu lo stedu be x2
column41: x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2; (adjective:) x1 is facial ||| (cf. sefta, stedu, crane, mebri)

column2:
'''flora''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a flower of plant or species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' ; x<sub>2</sub> is in the bloom
:'''lo flora''' — flower. '''lo se flora''' — blooming. 
:'''i lo se flora poi do viska cu rozgu''' — ''This flower is a rose.''
:Related words: {spati}, {panci}, {sumne}
column16: is a flower of plant or species

column2:
'''flu'ente''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fluid flowing to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  via the route  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo flu'ente''' — fluent, fluid, flow. 
:'''i ti flu'ente pa lalxu pa galtu krasi pe bu'u loi cmana lo condi''' — ''This is a current in a deep bed running towards a lake from high springheads in the mountains.''
:'''i lo flu'ente pe lo bu'u tcadu cu carmi''' — ''The traffic in this city is intense.''
:'''i lo nazbi be mi cu ve flu'ente''' — ''I have a runny nose.''
:'''i le cmana mo'u se flu'ente lo glare''' — ''The mountain erupted jetting hot matter.''
:Comment: {muvdu} is a more general term. {senta} is for where no directionality is implied.
:Related words: {rirxe}, {naxle}, {senta}, {rinci}, {xampo}, {letri}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}
column25: {muvdu} is a more general term. {senta} is for where no directionality is implied.

column2:
'''foldi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a field made of material  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo foldi''' — field. 
:'''i mi vreta bu'u pa foldi be lo flora''' — ''I'm lying on a flower field.''
:Related words: {purdi}, {cange}
column16: is a field made of material
column41: x1 is a field [shape/form] of material x2; x1 is a broad uniform expanse of x2 ||| [also woods (= ricfoi), lawn/meadow (= sasfoi), brush (= spafoi, cicyspafoi)]; (cf. purdi, cange)

column2:
'''fonmo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some foam or froth of material  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with bubbles of material  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fonmo''' — foam. '''lo te fonmo''' — bubble in foam. 
:'''i le glare pu ru'i cupra lo fonmo be lo djacu bei lo gapci''' — ''The heat was producing bubbles of gas in the water.''
:Related words: {zbabu}
column16: is some foam or froth of material
column41: x1 is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material x2, with bubbles/vacuoles of material x3 ||| (cf. zbabu)

column2:
'''fonxa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a phone or modem in network  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fonxa''' — telephone, phone. '''lo se fonxa''' — phone network. 
:'''i ti fonxa lo skori e nai lo te cradi''' — ''This is a landline phone, not a radiophone.''
:Related words: {tcana}
column7: x1 cabra lo ka benji je te benji lo selba'u ja selci'a lo darno fu x2 noi ciste ja se tcana
column16: is a phone or modem in network
column41: x1 is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network x2 ||| (cf. tcana)

column2:
'''forca''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fork for  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  with tines  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  on base  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo forca''' — fork. 
:'''i ti forca lo nu jukpa vau lo ci mei lo mudri''' — ''This is a wooden fork for cooking with three tines.''
:Related words: {dakfu}, {smuci}, {kombitu}, {tutci}
column7: x1 tutci x2 noi ka ralte ja lafti ku'o gi'e se pagbu lo grana noi se jimca lo su'o re kinli
column41: x1 is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose x2 with tines/prongs x3 on base/support x4 ||| (cf. dakfu, smuci, komcu, tutci)

column2:
'''fragari''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a strawberry of species/breed  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fragari''' — strawberry. 
:'''i lo fragari cu je'a titla''' — ''Strawberries are really sweet.''
:Related words: {jbari}, {grute}, {rozgu}

'''fraso''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is French in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fraso''' — French. 
:'''i xu do tavla fo lo fraso''' — ''Do you speak French?''
:Related words: {ropno}
column7: x1 ckini lo kulnu ja bangu ja cecmu ja natmi pe lo banfuru'a ja gugdefuru x2
column41: x1 reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2 ||| (cf. ropno)

column25: ?needed because "computer responds". moved to spuda.
column37: respond [to], react [to], treat [to], handle (deal with or behave towards in a specific way) [to]

column2:
'''fraxu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  forgives  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo te fraxu''' — action forgiven. 
:'''i ko fraxu mi lo ka jai lerci''' — ''Forgive me for being late.''

column7: x1 jdice lo du'u x1 na fengu x2 lo ka ce'u pu zukte ja ckaji x3 noi ke'a xlali x1 ja noi ke'a ka ce'u xrani ja drigau ce'u
column41: x1 forgives x2 for event/state/activity x3 ||| (cf. dunda, curmi, zungi)

column2:
'''frica''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  differs from  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2 with {kau})</sub>'' 
:'''lo frica''' — something different. 
:'''i mi frica do lo ka nelci ma kau''' — ''You and I differ from each other in what we like.''
:Related words: {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}
column7: x1 to'e dunli x2 boi x3
column34: property of x1 and x2 with {kau}
column41: x1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3 ||| [also other-than (less common meaning)]; (cf. ranxi, drata, dunli, simsa, vrici)

column2:
'''friko''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is African in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo friko''' — African. 
:'''i au mi viska lo friko xanto''' — ''I want to see African elephants.''
:Related words: {ropno}, {xazdo}
column41: x1 reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2 ||| (cf. ropno, xazdo)

column2:
'''frili''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  is easy for  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo frili''' — easy. 
:'''i ti noi karce cu jai frili fai lo ka se sazri''' — ''This car is easy to handle.''
:'''i na pu frili mi fa lo ka zvafa'i lei ckiku''' — ''It wasn't easy for me to find the keys.''
:Related words: {nandu}, {sampu}, {zifre}
column7: lo nu x1 se snada x2 cu na se sarcu lo nu x2 mutce lo ka troci ja gunka ja ta'irbi'o ja nenxaksu .i x1 to'e nandu x2
column41: x1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x2 (agent) under conditions x3; x2 does x1 freely/easily ||| (cf. nandu, sampu, zifre)

column2:
'''frinu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fraction of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  divided by  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo frinu''' — fraction. '''lo se frinu''' — numerator of a fraction. '''lo te frinu''' — denominator of a fraction. 
:'''i li re frinu li bi li vo''' — ''2 = 8 / 2.''
:Related words: {parbi}, {dilcu}, {mekso}, {fendi}
column41: x1 is a fraction, with numerator x2, denominator x3 (x2/x3) ||| (cf. parbi, dilcu, mekso, fendi)

column2:
'''friti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  offers  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo se friti''' — offering. 
:'''i mi pu friti fi le mamta fe lo nu mi sidju le verba lo ka klama lo cnita''' — ''I offered the mother to help the child to go down.''
:Related words: {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}
column5: _-(x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, posyselfriti for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.
column6: _+(x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity, an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, posyselfriti for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.
column41: x1 offers/proffers x2 [offering] to x3 with conditions x4 ||| [(x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posfriti, posyselfriti for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. canja, dunda, rinsa, vecnu, jdima, cnemu, pleji, vitke)
x1 frowns/grimaces (facial expression) ||| [x1 frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to x2 (= frufra)]; (cf. cmila, cisma)

column2:
'''fukpi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a copy of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in form  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  made by method  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fukpi''' — copy, replica. 
:'''i mi ralte pa fukpi be ti noi pixra bei pa bukpu pe lo jubme bei lo nu prina''' — ''I have a printed copy of this picture made as a tablecloth.''
:Related words: {krefu}, {rapli}, {gidva}, {zi'evla}
column41: x1 is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x2 in form/medium x3 made by method x4 (event) ||| (cf. krefu, rapli, gidva); [borrowing (=fu'ivla)]

column16: floats in or on gas or fluid
column41: x1 (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) x2; x1 is buoyant ||| (cf. limna, bloti, sakli)

column2:
'''funca''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  is determined by the good or bad luck of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo funca''' — luck (good or bad). 
:'''i mi se funca lo ka se jundi ro da''' — ''I'm lucky in that everybody listens to me.''
:Related words: {cunso}, {mabla}, {zabna}
column16: is determined by the good or bad luck of
column41: x1 (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of x2; (note mabla/zabna not implied) ||| (cf. cunso, mabla, zabna)

column2:
'''fusra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  rots or decays ...
:'''lo fusra''' — rotting. 
:'''i pa perli mo'u fusra''' — ''There is one pear and it is rotten.''
:Related words: {birje}, {vanju}, {vifne}
column41: x1 rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent x2; x1 is rotten/decayed/fermented ||| (cf. birje, vanju, vifne)

column2:
'''fuzme''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is responsible for  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  to authority  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo fuzme''' — responsible for, accountable for. 
:'''i la alis pu jai se facki fai lo ka na fuzme le zekri vau le kamni''' — ''Alice was found not responsible for the crime by the committee.''
:Related words: {bilga}
column41: x1 is responsible/accountable for x2 (action/resulting state) to judge/authority x3 ||| (cf. bilga)

column2:
'''gacri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a lid for covering  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo gacri''' — lid. '''lo se gacri''' — something with a lid. 
:'''i lo snime cu gacri le dertu''' — ''Snow covers the ground.''
:Related words: {pilka}, {gapru}, {marbi}, {drudi}, {botpi}, {bitmu}, {calku}
column7: x1 pagbu je bartu je marbi x2
column41: x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2 ||| (cf. pilka, gapru, marbi, drudi, ve botpi, bitmu, calku)

column2:
'''gadri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a gadri, a grammatical particle producing noun out of verb  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo gadri''' — gadri (grammatical particle). 
:'''i zo le gadri lu nu dansu li'u''' — ''{le} is a gadri.''
:Comment: {lo}, {le}, {la}, {lai}, {loi}, {lei}, {lo'e}, {le'e} are the most common gadri.
:Related words: {valsi}, {cmavo}
column16: is a gadri, a grammatical particle producing noun out of verb
column25: {lo}, {le}, {la}, {lai}, {loi}, {lei}, {lo'e}, {le'e} are the most common gadri.
column41: x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4 ||| [x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu]; 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] (cf. valsi, cmavo)

column2:
'''galfi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  transforms, modifies, changes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  into  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo galfi''' — modifier, transformer. 
:'''i le mamta pu galfi le rectu jo'u le nanba lo pluka snuji''' — ''Mother turned the meat and the bread into lovely sandwiches.''
:'''i ju'o le ninmu ba galfi la kevin lo speni be vo'a''' — ''I'm sure she will make Kevin her spouse.''
:'''i lo lenku brife pu galfi le pezli lo bunre''' — ''The cold wind turned the leaves brown.''
:Comment: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
:Related words: {stika}, {binxo}, {cenba}, {zasni}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 binxo x3
column25: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
column41: x1 (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts x2 into x3 ||| [causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= gafygau, gafyzu'e)]; (cf. stika for non-resultative, binxo for not-necessarily causal change, cenba for non-resultative change; zasni)

column2:
'''galtu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is high in reference frame  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is an upper part of x<sub>2</sub> ...
:'''lo galtu''' — high. 
:'''i le cipni cu galtu mi''' — ''The bird is high compared to me.''
:Related words: {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}
column7: x1 mutce lo ka gapru x2 .i x1 to'e dizlo x2
column24: x<sub>1</sub> is an upper part of x<sub>2</sub>
column41: x1 is high/up/upward in frame of reference x2 as compared with baseline/standard height x3 ||| [also upper; x3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself]; (cf. gapru, dizlo, cnita, drudi, farna)

column2:
'''galxe''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a throat of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo galxe''' — throat. 
:'''i da'i lo djacu cu xamgu lo galxe be do''' — ''Water would be fine for your throat.''
:Related words: {cnebo}, {kevna}, {tunlo}
column41: x1 is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole] ||| (cf. cnebo, kevna, tunlo)

column2:
'''ganlo''' — portal  ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is closed, preventing access to place  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for object  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ganlo''' — closed. 
:'''i le vorme cu ganlo lo nenri lo fange''' — ''The door is closed not letting the strangers in.''
:Related words: {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}
column7: lo nu pagre x1 boi (to noi vorme toi) x2 fa x3 fo zi'o cu se zunti zi'o zi'o
column16: is closed, preventing access to place
column41: x1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to x2 by x3 ||| [as a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane]; (cf. kalri, pagre, canko, vorme, zunti)

column2:
'''ganra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is broad or wide in length/width etc.  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo ganra''' — broad, wide. 
:'''i le tricu cu ganra lo ka se midju''' — ''The tree is thick in the middle.''
:Comment: the second largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects.
:Related words: {clani}, {jarki}, {rotsu}, {condi}, {barda}, {gutci}, {minli}
column7: x1 barda x2 noi remoi cimde x1 ku'o x3
column16: is broad or wide in length/width etc.
column25: the second largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects.
column41: x1 is broad/wide in dimension x2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x3 ||| (cf. clani, jarki, rotsu, condi, barda, gutci, minli)

column2:
'''ganse''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  detects or senses  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by means  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo se ganse''' — feeling (sensation). 
:'''i mi ganse lo nu ti cpina vau lo ka smaka ri''' — ''I sense it being irritating by tasting it.''
:Related words: {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}
column7: x1 pilno x3 lo ka ce'u viska ja tirna ja sumne ja sanji x2
column41: x1 [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus property x2 (ka) by means x3 under conditions x4 ||| [x1 is sensitive to x2; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates x1 and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); x3 sense/sensory channel]; (cf. pencu, sanji, viska, sumne, tirna, zgana, canci, simlu)

column2:
'''ganti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a gonad/ovary of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  of sex  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ganti''' — gonad. '''lo te ganti''' — sex (biological). 
:'''i lo xanto cu se ganti lo barda lo nakni''' — ''Male elephants have large testicles.''
:Related words: {plibu}, {sovda}, {nakpinji}, {gutra}, {mabla}
column41: x1 is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of x2, gender x3 ||| [egg/sperm/pollen/gamete producing/bearing organ]; (cf. plibu, sovda, pinji, gutra, mabla)

column2:
'''ganxo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the anus of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ganxo''' — anus. 
:'''i le mikce pu kucli tu'a lo nabmi pe lo ganxo be le nanmu''' — ''The doctor was curious about the problem with the anus of the man.''
:Related words: {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}
column5: _-Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) x1 is anal. See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.
column6: _+Also asshole/ass/arsehole. See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.
column41: x1 is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: exit, waste exit] ||| [also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) x1 is anal]; (cf. zargu, kalci, mabla, rinci)

column2:
'''ganzu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  organizes chaos  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  into order  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by principle  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ganzu''' — organizer. '''lo se ganzu''' — chaotic, not organized. '''lo te ganzu''' — organized. 
:'''i le turni pu ganzu lo ruble prenu lo vlipa jenmi lo ka bapli lo nu le jenmi cu zukte lo te minde''' — ''He turned weak people into a powerful army by making them execute orders.''
:Related words: {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {cabra}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 binxo x3 noi cnici ja se javni x4
column41: x1 organizes x2 [relative chaos] into x3 [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) x4 ||| [x3 is also a system; x4 could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of x3]; (cf. ciste, morna, stura, bilni, cabra)

column2:
'''gapci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a gas ...
:'''lo gapci''' — gas. 
:'''i ti noi karce cu se livla lo gapci''' — ''This car is powered by gas.''
:Related words: {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flu'ente}
column7: x1 marji x2 noi lo selci be ke'a cu prane lo ka ka'e muvdu .i x1 frica lo litki .e lo sligu lo ka jitcau lo ka preja
column41: x1 is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including x2, under conditions x3 ||| [x3 includes temperature and pressure]; (cf. pambe, vacri, litki, sligu, danmo, bumru, cidro, flecu)

column2:
'''gapru''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is directly above  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo gapru''' — something above. 
:'''i le solri ca gapru mi''' — ''The Sun is now above me.''

column41: x1 is directly/vertically above/upwards-from x2 in gravity/frame of reference x3 ||| (cf. tsani, galtu, cnita, drudi, gacri, dizlo, farna)

column2:
'''garna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a railing or bar supporting or restraining  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo garna''' — rail. 
:'''i ti garna lo xance''' — ''This is a handrail.''
:Related words: {kamju}, {grana}, {tutci}
column7: x1 tutci lo ka sarji ja se rinju x2 kei gi'e grana x3
column16: is a railing or bar supporting or restraining
column41: x1 is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining x2, of material x3 ||| (cf. kamju, grana, tutci)

column2:
'''gasnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  causes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  to happen
:'''lo gasnu''' — agent. 
:'''i do pu gasnu lo nu mi klaku''' — ''You made me cry.''
:Comment: {lo} {zukte} is @@@who do something themselves, {lo} {gasnu} is @@@agent who causes something@@@, {lo} {se} {jalge} is @@@event that causes something@@@.
:Related words: {gau}, {gunka}, {zukte}, {rinka}, {fasnu}, {jibri}, {kakne}, {pilno}
column7: lo nu x1 zukte cu selja'e x2
column25: {lo} {zukte} is @@@who do something themselves, {lo} {gasnu} is @@@agent who causes something@@@, {lo} {se} {jalge} is @@@event that causes something@@@.
column41: x1 [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event x2; x1 does/brings about x2 ||| (cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)

column2:
'''gasta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some steel ...
:'''lo gasta''' — steel. 
:'''i lo balre be ti noi dakfu cu gasta''' — ''The blade of this knife is made of steel.''
:Related words: {jinme}, {molki}, {tirse}
column41: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including x2 ||| (cf. jinme, molki, tirse)

column2:

column2:
'''jdice''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  makes a judgement, decides that  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is true about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

:'''i xu do jdice lo ka jai se kufra vau lo zdani be do''' — ''Have you decided that your home is comfortable?''
:'''i mi'a zanru lo se jdice be le kamni''' — ''We welcome the decision of the committee.''

column2:

column2:
'''jdima''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  is the price of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  set by  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jdima''' — price. '''lo se jdima''' — something having a price. '''lo ve jdima''' — price-maker. 
:'''i ma jdima ti fo do''' — ''What is your price for this?''
:'''i lo rupnu be li ci cu jdima lo ka sazri lo se kelci karce vau lo verba lo ponse be lo karce''' — ''Three dollars is the price of riding a toy car for children set by the owner of the car.''
:Comment: {lo} {vamji} is @@@value@@@, {lo} {ve} {vecnu} is for @@@cost@@@.
:Related words: {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji}, {ve} {vecnu}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}
column5: _-x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as 'value' or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.
column6: _+x2 may be a specific object, a commodity, an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as 'value' or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.
column7: x1 tolrai lo ka x3 nitcu lo ka renvi ja dunda kei lo ka cpacu ja ralte x2
column25: {lo} {vamji} is @@@value@@@, {lo} {ve} {vecnu} is for @@@cost@@@.
column41: x1 [amount] is the price of x2 to purchaser/consumer x3 set by vendor x4 ||| [x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydi'a, posyseldi'a for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as "value" or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace)]; (cf. canja, friti, janta, jdini, kargu, pleji, dapma, vamji for 'value', ve vecnu for 'cost', canja, fepni, jerna, jinga, pleji, prali, rupnu, sfasa, vamji)

column2:

:'''lo jivna''' — competitor. '''lo se jivna''' — opponent in a competition. '''lo te jivna''' — competition. '''lo ve jivna''' — prize in a competition. 
:'''i la alis pu jivna lo drata nixli pa nu vi'i ve'u bajra vau lo ka cpacu lo jdini''' — ''Alice competed with other girls in a long distance race with a monetary prize for the winner.''
:Related words: {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}
column7: x1 fapro x2 x3 gi'e troci lo ka jinga fi x2 fo x3 fe x4
column41: x1 competes/vies with opponent x2 in contest/competition x3 (event) for gain x4; x1 rivals x2 ||| [also x2 opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); x3 competition, race; x4 prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external)]; (cf. cnemu, jinga, talsa, bradi, fapro, kelci)

column2:
'''jmaji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>''  gather at location  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from locations  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jmaji''' — gatherers. '''lo se jmaji''' — location of gathering. 
:'''i lo jbopre pu jmaji pa dinju lo vrici gugde''' — ''Lojbanists from various countries gathered in a house.''
:Related words: {crepu}
column3: -x1 (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location x2 from locations x3 (mass/jo'u).
column4: _+x1 gather(s)/collect(s) at location x2 from locations x3.
column7: ge ro me x1 cu klama x2 boi su'o me x3 gi ro me x3 cu te klama x2 boi su'o me x1 vau ja'e lo nu x1 zvati x2
column41: x1 (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location x2 from locations x3 (mass/jo'u) ||| [also focus (= seljmaji)]; (cf. crepu)

column2:
'''jmifa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a shoal or reef ...
:'''lo jmifa''' — shoal. 
:'''i pu zdile fa lo ka limna ne'a loi jmifa''' — ''It was amusing to swim near the reefs.''
:Related words: {caxno}
column41: x1 is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material x2 in body of water x3 ||| [rapids (= ri'erjmifa, ri'ercaxno)]; (cf. caxno)

column2:
'''jmina''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  combines or adds  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity, property of x3)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with result  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity, property of x3)</sub>'' 
:'''i le sfofa cu jmina lo ka se kufra vau le kumfa''' — ''The sofa adds comfort to the room.''
:'''i mi ba jmina lo so'o crino spati le nanba lo pa snuji''' — ''I will add some greenery to bread getting a sandwich.''
:Related words: {zmadu}, {banro}, {sumji}, {zenba}, {setca}
column7: x1 dunda x2 boi x3 ja'e x4 i x1 gasnu lo nu x3 zenba fi x2 ja'e x4
column41: x1 adds/combines x2 to/with x3, with result x4; x1 augments x2 by amount x3 ||| (cf. zmadu, banro, sumji, zenba, setca)

column2:
'''jmive''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is alive in that it does  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jmive''' — alive, living being. 
:'''i le danlu cu jmive lo ka ruble muvdu''' — ''The animal is alive since it is weakly moving.''
:Related words: {lifri}, {morsi}, {stuzi}, {zvati}, {xabju}
column5: _-(adjective:) x1 is vital, organic. See also {lifri}, {morsi}, {stuzi}, {zvati}, {xabju}.
column6: _+See also {lifri}, {morsi}, {stuzi}, {zvati}, {xabju}.
column7: x1 se tcini lo ka jbena gi'e banro gi'e ka'e rorci gi'e matybi'o lo vanbi ta'i lo nu nenri krasi cenba .i x1 to'e morsi
column16: is alive in that it does
column41: x1 lives/is alive by standard x2; x1 is an organism/living thing ||| [(adjective:) x1 is vital, organic]; (cf. lifri, morsi, stuzi, zvati, xabju)

column2:
'''jorne''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is joined to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  at location  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jorne''' — tightened, connected, tied, joined, fastened. 
:'''i la alis cu jorne pa stizu pa skori''' — ''Alice is tied to a chair with a rope.''
:'''i ko jorne la'e me'o so pa pa''' — ''Call 911!''
:'''i mi ba jorne do ba lo nu mi cliva lo ckule''' — ''I will call you after I leave the school.''
:Comment: x<sub>1</sub> and x<sub>2</sub> form a union.
:Related words: {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}
column7: x3 korbi x1 fi x2 .i je x1 jo'u x2 rinju x3 lo ka simxu lo ka zvadarze'a
column25: x<sub>1</sub> and x<sub>2</sub> form a union.
column41: x1 is joined to/connects to/is united with x2 at common locus x3; x1 and x2 are a union ||| [also joined/fastened/attached by joint x3/by means of x3/with fastener x3; fastener (= jo'etci, jonvelyla'a); train, sequence of joined objects (= jonpoi; porjo'e for a single object joined into a sequence)]; (cf. lasna, fenso, kansa, pencu, penmi)

column2:
'''jubme''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a table ...
:'''lo jubme''' — table. 
:'''i xu da kunti jubme''' — ''Is there a free table?''

column41: x1 is a table/flat solid upper surface of material x2, supported by legs/base/pedestal x3 ||| (cf. ckana, jamfu, nilce, zbepi, tsina, stizu)

column2:
'''judri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an address of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in system  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo judri''' — address. '''lo te judri''' — address system. 
:'''i ma judri do lo tcadu''' — ''What is your city address?''
:'''i ma judri do lo kibro ve mrilu''' — ''What is your e-mail address?''

column7: x1 sinxa lo du'u ma kau stuzi x2 kei ma'i x3
column41: x1 is an address of/are coordinates of x2 in system x3 ||| (cf. tcita, cmene, ciste, stuzi)

column2:
'''jufra''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a sentence or statement about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in language  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jufra''' — sentence. '''lo se jufra''' — topic of a sentence. '''lo te jufra''' — language of a sentence. 
:'''i lu i lo mlatu cu pinxe li'u jufra lo danlu la lojban''' — ''{i lo mlatu cu pinxe} is a sentence about animals in Lojban language.''
:Related words: {valsi}, {bangu}, {gerna}, {cusku}, {smuni}
column7: x1 porsi lo su'o pa valsi gi'e se smuni lo srana be x2 gi'e gerna selci x3 noi bangu
column16: is a sentence or statement about

column2:
'''jukpa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  cooks or prepares food  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by recipe  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jukpa''' — cook. '''lo se jukpa''' — cooked food. '''lo te jukpa''' — recipe for cooking. 
:'''i le mamta pu jukpa pa torta lo ka punji pa pu'o torta lo toknu''' — ''Mother cooked a cake by putting a raw "cake" in the oven.''
:Comment: x<sub>2</sub> is the result of cooking, the product ready to use.
:Related words: {cupra}, {bredi}
column7: x1 bregau x2 lo ka se citka kei ta'i x3
column25: x<sub>2</sub> is the result of cooking, the product ready to use.
column41: x1 cooks/prepares food-for-eating x2 by recipe/method x3 (process) ||| [cook with heat (= glajukpa, glaterjukpa), bake (= tokyjukpa); fry (= rasyjukpa)]; (cf. cupra, bredi)

column2:
'''julne''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a filter passing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  and prohibiting  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo julne''' — filter. 
:'''i ti julne fi lo finpe''' — ''This is a fishing net.''
:'''i tu julne lo djacu lo rismi''' — ''That is a colander that lets the water pass and retains rice.''

column41: x1 is a net/filter allowing passage of x2, prohibiting passage of x3, netting properties x4 ||| [also sieve]; (cf. komcu, ciste, jgena)

column2:
'''jundi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  pays attention to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo jundi''' — attentive. '''lo se jundi''' — object of attention. 
:'''i mi pu jundi lo nu ra pu cusku ma kau''' — ''I was attentive at was he was saying.''

column7: x1 selfargau lo menli be vo'a x2
column41: x1 is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair x2 ||| (cf. kurji, zvati)

column2:

column2:
'''junla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a timer, clock measuring time units  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...

:'''i ti junla lo snidu be li pi mu''' — ''This clock measures seconds to the precision of 0.5 seconds.''
:Comment: x<sub>2</sub> can be show the precision to which time units are measured.

column25: x<sub>2</sub> can be show the precision to which time units are measured.

column2:

:Comment: Some junipers are commonly called "cedars".
