column2:
'''renro''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  throws or launches  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  to or at  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se renro''' — thrown. 
:'''i pa nanla pu renro pa rokci le canko''' — ''A boy threw a stone at the window.''
:Comment: {cecla} is a more general term.
:Related words: {cecla}, {danti}
column7: x1 gasnu ja bapli lo nu x2 cliva x1 fa'a x3 .i x1 cecla x2 fa'a x3
column25: {cecla} is a more general term.
column41: x1 throws/launches/casts/hurls x2 to/at/in direction x3 (propulsion derives internally to x1) ||| (cf. cecla (more general term), danti)

column2:
'''renvi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  survives or endures  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo renvi''' — survivor. '''lo se renvi''' — age. 
:'''i mi mo'u renvi le xlali tcini''' — ''I survived that terrible situation.''
:Related words: {ranji}, {kuspe}, {fapro}, {lifri}, {stali}, {temci}
column5: _-Also lasts out, withstands; x1 persists/lasts for duration x3; (adjective:) x1 is tough/durable. See also {ranji}, {kuspe}, {randa}, {lifri}, {stali}, {temci}.
column6: _+Also lasts out, withstands; x1 persists/lasts for duration x3. See also {ranji}, {kuspe}, {randa}, {lifri}, {stali}, {temci}.
column7: x1 lifri je na'e randa x2 .i x2 na fanta lo nu x1 stali lo ka jmive ja zasti
column41: x1 survives/endures/undergoes/abides/lasts/persists through x2 for interval/duration x3 ||| [also lasts out, withstands; x1 persists/lasts for duration x3; (adjective:) x1 is tough/durable]; (cf. ranji, kuspe, randa, lifri, stali, temci)

column2:
'''respa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a reptile of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo respa''' — reptile. 
:'''i lo respa cu xabju le korbi be le rirxe''' — ''Reptiles inhabit the coast of the river.''
:Related words: {danlu}, {banfi}, {since}
column7: x1 lekselblu bogda'u x2 noi jutsi la'o klesi Reptilia klesi
column41: x1 is a reptile of species/breed x2 ||| (cf. danlu, banfi, since)

column2:
'''ricfu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is rich in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ricfu''' — rich, wealthy. 
:'''i xu do ricfu lo ka ponse lo tumla''' — ''Are you rich in how much land you own?''
:Comment: x<sub>2</sub> specifies the actual state of affairs that describes why x<sub>1</sub> is considered rich.
:Related words: {solji}, {banzu}, {zildukse}, {pindi}
column7: x1 mutce lo ka tolcau ja ponse x2 .i x1 to'e pindi x2
column25: x<sub>2</sub> specifies the actual state of affairs that describes why x<sub>1</sub> is considered rich.
column41: x1 is rich/wealthy in goods/possessions/property/aspect x2 ||| (cf. solji, banzu, dukse, pindi)

column2:
'''rigni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is disgusting to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo rigni''' — disgusting. 
:'''i le cidja cu rigni mi''' — ''The food is disgusting to me.''
:Related words: {djica}, {nelci}, {trina}, {vamtu}, {xebni}, {pluka}
column7: x1 to'e se nelci ja to'e melbi ja to'e kukte ja se malfri x2 .i x1 to'e pluka x2
column41: x1 is repugnant to/causes disgust to x2 under conditions x3 ||| (cf. djica, nelci, trina, vamtu, xebni, pluka)

column2:
'''rijno''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a quantity of silver
:'''lo rijno''' — silver. 
:'''i le sicni cu rijno''' — ''The coin is silver.''
:Related words: {solji}
column7: x1 blabi je ranti jinme cmuxu'i gi'e se pilno fi lo ka zbasu lo minra jo'u lo sicni jo'u lo jadni jo'u ctitci li'o kei gi'e se sinxa zo'oi Ag
column41: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of silver/argentum (Ag); [metaphor: valuable, tarnishing] ||| (cf. solji)

column2:
'''rilti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a rhythm, rhythmical pattern of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rilti''' — rhythm. '''lo se rilti''' — having a rhythm. 
:'''i lo rilti be le pu se sanga be le nakni cu simsa lo'u la la cu cu la la le'u''' — ''The rhythm of the phrase said by him was similar to {la la tcu tcu la la}.''
:Related words: {damri}, {pemci}, {tonga}, {zgike}, {slilu}, {dikni}, {sanga}, {morna}
column16: is a rhythm, rhythmical pattern of
column41: x1 (sequence/non-text quote) is a rhythm/beat of music/expressive form x2 ||| [not necessarily oscillatory/regular pattern]; (cf. damri, pemci, tonga, zgike, slilu, dikni, sanga, morna)

column2:
'''rimni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  rhymes with  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  in language  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with correspondence  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rimni''' — having a rhyme. '''lo se rimni''' — rhyming with something. 
:'''i zo kansa rimni zo dansu la lojban lo ka lo ci lamji lerfu je pagbu be ce'u cu simxu lo ka mintu''' — ''{kansa} rhymes with {dansu} in Lojban in that three adjacent letters in each of those words are the same.''
:Related words: {pemci}, {sanga}
column41: x1 rhymes/alliterates with x2 in language/phonetics x3, matching sound correspondence x4 (ka) ||| [broad meaning of rhyme - any matching sound correspondence]; (cf. pemci, sanga)

column2:
'''rinci''' — liquid  ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  drains or flushes from  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  through drain  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by force  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rinci''' — draining liquid. '''lo te rinci''' — drain, strainer, colander. 
:'''i lo djacu cu rinci pa tubnu za'u pa kevna lo danre''' — ''Water drains from a tube through holes being under pressure.''
:Related words: {pambe}, {tisna}, {setca}, {flu'ente}, {muvdu}, {ganxo}, {rirxe}
column41: x1 liquid/fluid drains/strains/flushes from source x2 through drain/strainer x3 by force x4 ||| [x4 is usually gravity]; (cf. pambe, tisna, setca, flecu, muvdu, ganxo, rirxe)

column2:
'''rinju''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is restrained by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  against  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rinju''' — restrained. '''lo se rinju''' — restraining. 
:'''i lo carmi flu'ente be lo le tcadu pu se rinju mi lo ka tsuku le briju''' — ''Intense traffic prevented me from getting to the office.''
:Related words: {zifre}, {ralte}, {pinfu}, {kavbu}, {fanta}, {jgari}, {jimte}, {bapli}, {e'ande}, {kluza}, {tagji}
column7: x1 jai se fanta x2 fai x3 .i x2 gasnu lo nu x1 na zifre x3
column41: x1 is restrained/held [back]/constrained/kept by restraint x2 against x3 (event) ||| [also: x2 is a restraint/binding for x1, x2 keeps/restrains/holds [back]/constrains x1 from x3 (= selri'u for reordered places); agentive restraint (= ri'urgau, ri'urzu'e)]; (cf. zifre, ralte, pinfu, kavbu, fanta, jgari, jimte, bapli, curmi, kluza, tagji)

column2:
'''rinka''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  causes effect  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo rinka''' — cause. '''lo se rinka''' — effect. 
:'''i lo nu ctuca cu rinka lo nu farvi''' — ''Education is the agent of progress.''
:Related words: {gasnu}, {krinu}, {nibli}, te {zukte}, se {jalge}, {bapli}, {jitro}, {ri'a}, {mukti}, {ciksi}, {volta}
column7: lo nu x1 fasnu na kakne lo ka na se jalge lo nu x2 fasnu
column41: x1 (event/state) effects/physically causes effect x2 (event/state) under conditions x3 ||| [x1 is a material condition for x2; x1 gives rise to x2]; (cf. gasnu, krinu, nibli, te zukte, se jalge, bapli, jitro, cmavo list ri'a, mukti, ciksi, xruti)

column7: x1 frati x3 le nu x2 tolcliva
column41: x1 (agent) greets/hails/[welcomes/says hello to]/responds to arrival of x2 in manner x3 (action) ||| (cf. friti for welcome/hospitality, cmavo list coi, cmavo list co'o)

column7: x1 to'e rinsa x2 boi x3 .i x1 frati x3 le nu x2 cliva
column37: say goodby to [to], bid farewell to [to]

column2:
'''rirci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is rare, not usual in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  among  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rirci''' — rare. 
:'''i le fetsi cu rirci lo ka carmi gunka vau lo tadni poi dunli vo'a lo ka jai nanca''' — ''She works hard which is unusual among students of her age.''
:'''i mi pu rirci fi lo pendo be mi fe lo ka se cinri lo fasnu e nai lo farna''' — ''I was unusual among my friends in being interested in events and not trends.''
:Related words: {cizra}, {fadni}, {cafne}, {kampu}, {cnano}
column3: -x1 [member] is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set).
column4: _+x1 is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property x2 (ka) among x3.
column5: _-(x3 is complete specification of set); (cf. cizra, fadni, cafne, kampu, cnano - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)
column6: _+(cf. cizra, fadni, cafne, kampu, cnano - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)
column7: x1 ckaji x2 gi'e cmima x3 noi se cmima so'u ckaji be x2 .i x1 to'e fadni x2 x3
column41: x1 [member] is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set) ||| (x3 is complete specification of set); (cf. cizra, fadni, cafne, kampu, cnano - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)

column2:
'''rirni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  rears  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is a parent of x<sub>2</sub>
:'''lo rirni''' — parent (rearer). 
:'''i la edvard cu rirni la alis''' — ''Edward is a parent of Alice.''
:Related words: {rorci}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {sidju}, {dzena}, {famti}, {verba}, {bersa}
column7: x1 kurji x2 ze'a lo nu x2 banro lo makcu lo cifnu
column24: x<sub>1</sub> is a parent of x<sub>2</sub>
column41: x1 is a parent of/raises/rears x2; x1 mentors/acts parental toward child/protege x2 ||| (cf. rorci, mamta, patfu, sidju, dzena, famti, verba, bersa)

column2:
'''rirxe''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a river of land mass  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  draining watershed  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo rirxe''' — river. '''lo te rirxe''' — watershed of a river. 
:'''i ti rirxe pa sudga tumla lo vifne poi flu'ente lo xamsi lo krasi pe lo cmana lo condi''' — ''This is a river in a dry land running its fresh waters in a deep river bed towards the sea from springheads in the mountains.''
:Related words: {flu'ente}, {naxle}, {senta}, {daplu}, {djacu}, {lalxu}, {xamsi}, {rinci}
column7: x1 flecu lo djacu tu'i x2 noi tumla ku'o fo x3 fi x4
column16: is a river of land mass
column41: x1 is a river of land mass x2, draining watershed x3 into x4/terminating at x4 ||| (cf. flecu, senta for most metaphorical aspects; daplu, djacu, lalxu, xamsi, rinci, naxle)

column2:
'''rismi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some rice of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rismi''' — rice. 
:'''i mi citka lo rismi su'o roi ro djedi''' — ''I eat rice every day.''
:Related words: {gurni}
column7: x1 gurni ja spati x2 noi jutsi la'o jutsi Oryza sativa jutsi
column41: x1 is a quantity of rice [a type of grain] of strain/cultivar x2 ||| (cf. gurni)

column2:
'''risna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a heart of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo risna''' — heart. 
:'''i mi pu ganse lo nu lo rinsa be mi cu sutra slilu''' — ''I felt my heart beating fast.''
:Related words: {pambe}, {ciblu}
column5: _-(adjective:) x1 is cardiac; emotional 'heart' (= {cnise'i}). See also {pambe}, {ciblu}.
column6: _+Emotional 'heart' (= {cnise'i}). See also {pambe}, {ciblu}.
column41: x1 is a/the heart [body-part] of x2; [emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral] ||| [(adjective:) x1 is cardiac; emotional 'heart' (= cnise'i)]; (cf. pambe, ciblu)

column2:
'''ritli''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  is a ceremony, rite for purpose  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  in community  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo ritli''' — ceremony, rite. 
:'''i lo ka pinxe lo tcati su'o roi ro djedi vau fi mi'a ritli lo ka tavla zu'ai''' — ''To drink tea is our ritual that we perform every day in order to talk to each other.''
:Related words: {lijda}, {malsi}, {flalu}, {javni}, {tcaci}, {clite}, {junri}
column7: x1 se zukte fi x2 fe x1 gi'e se tarmi lo tcaci ja se javni ja se flalu
column16: is a ceremony, rite for purpose
column41: x1 is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal x2, by custom/in community x3, with form/rules x4 ||| [also: x1 is formal, [legal]; x1 is 'going through the motions']; x4 constraints/customs; (cf. lijda, malsi, flalu, javni, tcaci, clite, junri)

column2:
'''rivbi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  avoids or escapes fate  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity, property of x1)</sub>''  through action  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se rivbi''' — avoided event. 
:'''i mi pu rivbi lo ka bilma vau lo ka zmadu citka e lo ka jinru lo glare djacu''' — ''I avoided becoming ill by eating more and plunging into hot water.''
:'''i le prenu pu rivbi loi pulji''' — ''The person evaded the police.''
:Comment: {bandu} - @@@to defend@@@ (not necessarily successful), {fanta} - @@@to prevent@@@, {se} {jersi} - @@@to be chased@@@.
:Related words: {sisku}, {kalte}, {fapro}
column7: x1 zukte x3 lo nu naku x1 ckaji x2
column25: {bandu} - @@@to defend@@@ (not necessarily successful), {fanta} - @@@to prevent@@@, {se} {jersi} - @@@to be chased@@@.
column41: x1 avoids/evades/shuns/escapes/skirts [fate] x2 (event) through action/state x3 (event) ||| [also detours around, stays away from; (x1 is normally an object, but may be an event)]; (cf. bandu which is not necessarily successful, fanta, which is agentive, se jersi which implies an opposing agent, sisku, kalte, fapro)

column2:
'''rokci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a rock ...
:'''lo rokci''' — rock, stone. 
:'''i le nanla ca'o renro lo za'u rokci''' — ''The boy is throwing stones.''
:Related words: {kunra}, {jemna}, {canre}
column7: x1 jdari kunra marji x2 gi'e se krasi x3
column41: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains rock/stone of type/composition x2 from location x3 ||| [x2: composition including x2, which need not be complete specification];(cf. kunra, jemna, canre)

column7: x1 jinme x2 gi'e sefta gi'e ba'o se spali gi'e mutce lo ka minra
column16: is a highly reflective surface of metal
column41: x1 is a highly reflective/polished non-tarnishing metallic surface, of metal x2 [often chromium] ||| (cf. jinme)

column2:
'''cirkulo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a circle
:'''lo cirkulo''' — circle. 
:'''i mi pu ciska pa cirkulo''' — ''I drew a circle.''
:Related words: {cukla}, {djine}

'''djine''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a ring ...
:'''lo djine''' — ring. 
:'''i ti solji djine''' — ''This is a golden ring.''
:Related words: {cukla}
column7: x1 cukla clupa x2
column41: x1 is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material x2, inside diam. x3, outside diam. x4 ||| [also ellipse, oval (= jincla); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops)]; [also band, belt, encircle (= jinsru)]; (cf. clupa, cukla, dasri, karli, sovda, sruri, konju)

column2:
'''ropno''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is European in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo ropno''' — European. 
:'''i ti noi nanla cu ropno lo ka tavla tai ma kau''' — ''This boy is European in how he speaks.''
column41: x1 reflects European culture/nationality/geography/Indo-European languages in aspect x2 ||| (cf. brito)

column2:
'''rorci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  procreates  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with coparent  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rorci''' — parent (procreator), procreator. 
:'''i le ranmi danlu cu se rorci pa remna pa bakni''' — ''The mythical animal was procreated by a human and a bull.''
:Related words: {grute}, {gutra}, {rirni}, se {panzi}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {tarbi}, {bersa}, {ferti}, {jbena}, {sovda}
column7: x1 kansa x3 lo nu x2 co'a panzi x1 joi x3
column41: x1 engenders/procreates/begets x2 with coparent x3 ||| (cf. grute, gutra, rirni, se panzi, mamta, patfu, tarbi, bersa, ferti, jbena, sovda)

column2:
'''rotsu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is thick in length/width etc.  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo rotsu''' — thick. 
:'''i le dargu cu rotsu lo ka se pagbu ti''' — ''The road is thick here.''
:Comment: the third largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects.
:Related words: {barda}, {cinla}, {ganra}, {clani}, {condi}, {plana}, {gutci}, {minli}
column7: x1 barda x2 noi cmarai cimde x1 ku'o x3
column25: the third largest dimension. {ganra}, {rotsu} and {clani} specify the three dimensions of objects.
column41: x1 is thick in dimension/direction x2 by standard x3; [relatively long in smallest dimension] ||| [also stout]; (cf. barda, cinla, ganra, clani, condi, plana, gutci, minli)

column2:
'''rozgu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  a rose of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rozgu''' — rose (plant). 
:'''i pluka panci lo rozgu pe le purdi''' — ''Roses in the garden have a pleasant scent.''
:Related words: {spati}, {xunre}
column41: x1 is a rose [flower - characterized by prickly stem/fragrance] of species/strain x2 ||| [roses are not all pink; avoid using for color rose, which might be labyxu'e]; (cf. spati, xunre)

column2:
'''ruble''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is weak, frail in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo ruble''' — weak, frail. 
:'''i le laldo prenu cu ruble lo ka pinxe si'u nai''' — ''The old man is weak in being able to drink himself.''
:Related words: {carmi}, {vlipa}, {tsali}, {kandi}, {kandi}, {milxe}

column41: x1 is weak/feeble/frail in property/quality/aspect x2 (ka) by standard x3 ||| (cf. carmi, vlipa, tsali, kandi, kandi, milxe)

column2:
'''rufsu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is rough in texture
:'''lo rufsu''' — rough (in texture). 
:'''i le skapi cu rufsu''' — ''The skin is rough.''
:Related words: {xutla}, {tengu}, {vitci}
column7: x1 se tengu lo vitci .i x1 to'e xutla
column41: x1 is rough/coarse/uneven/[grainy/scabrous/rugged] in texture/regularity ||| [fine-textured (= tolrufsu)]; (cf. xutla, tengu, vitci)

column7: x1 noi sligu cu binxo lo litki

column2:
'''runta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  dissolves in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  making solution  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo runta''' — dissolving. '''lo te runta''' — solution (mixture). 
:'''i e'o te runta fi lo kunra''' — ''Mineral water, please.''
:'''i le jisra cu te runta lo sakta jo'u lo jbari lo djacu''' — ''The juice is made of sugar and berries dissolved in water.''

column41: x1 dissolves in solvent x2 forming solution/[suspension] x3 under conditions x4 ||| [suspension (= pucyteryrunta, pu'exre)]; (cf. litki, mixre, sligu, sudga)

column2:
'''rupnu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  costs  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  major money units in monetary system  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

:'''i ti noi jisra cu rupnu li ci la e'uropas''' — ''This juice costs three euros (European major money units).''

column18: major money units in monetary system
column26: measured in dollars / roubles / euro / yuan
column41: x1 is measured in major-money-units (dollar/yuan/ruble) as x2 (quantity), monetary system x3 ||| [also pound, rupee, franc, mark, yen; x1 is generally a price/cost/value]; (cf. jdini, sicni, jdima, vecnu, fepni, dekpu, gutci, minli, merli, bunda, kramu)

column2:
'''rusko''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is Russian in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rusko''' — Russian. 
:'''i xu do tavla fo lo rusko''' — ''Do you speak Russian?''
column7: x1 ckini lo kulnu ja bangu ja cecmu ja natmi pe lo banru'usu ja gugderu'u x2
column41: x1 reflects Russian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2 ||| (cf. softo, slovo)

column2:
'''rutni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is artificially made by people  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo rutni''' — artificial. 
:'''i ti noi jemna cu rutni lo patfu be mi''' — ''This gem is artificial and made by my father.''
:Related words: {rarna}, {se} {zbasu}, {arte}, {larcu}, {gundi}, {slasi}
column7: x1 se finti ja se zbasu ja se cupra lo remna .i x1 to'e rarna
column41: x1 is an artifact; x1 is artificial; x1 is made/caused by people/se kulnu x2; x1 is man-made ||| (cf. rarna, se zbasu, gundi, slasi)

column2:

column2:

column2:

column41: x1 is a cabin of vehicle x2 ||| (cf. bloti, marce, vinji, karce)

column2:

column2:

column2:

column41: x1 is sound produced/emitted by x2 ||| [x2 sounds (intransitive verb)]; (cf. savru, tirna, voksa, siclu, slaka)

column2:
'''sanga''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  sings  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(sound, text)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sanga''' — singer. '''lo se sanga''' — song, sung.

column2:

column2:

column2:
'''saske''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a lore, mass of facts about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  based on methodology  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''

:'''i mi tadni lo saske be le du'u mikce''' — ''I study the medical science.''
:'''i lo cmaci cu saske le du'u lo namcu cu simxu lo ka ckini vau lo nu lanli le namcu''' — ''Mathematic is a science of how numbers are related to each other based on their analysis.''

column16: is a lore, mass of facts about

column2:
'''satci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is exact to precision  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''

:'''i le jubme cu satci lo mitre be li pi no pa rau da lo ka mitre li re lo ka clani''' — ''The table is two meters long within an error of 0.01 meters.''
:Related words: {sarxe}, {dunli}, {merli}, {mapti}, {kancu}, {mintu}

column2:
'''savru''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a noise to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  perceived via  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''

:'''i lo vi ru'i nai gusni se la'u li du'e savru mi lo ka se viska''' — ''These flashes are too noisy.''
:Comment: noise can refer not only to sound but to any "noisy", i.e. irritating or chaotic objects.

:'''lo sazri''' — driver, operator. '''lo se sazri''' — driven, operated.

'''sefta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a surface of object  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo sefta''' — surface. 
:'''i lo sefta be le najnimre cu xutla''' — ''The orange has a soft surface.''
:Related words: {crane}, {flira}, {plita}, {bliku}

column2:
'''seksi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in activity or state  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  exhibits biological or social sexuality  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo seksi''' — sexy. '''lo se seksi''' — sexual activity. '''lo te seksi''' — social gender, biological gender. 
:'''i ti noi finpe ca seksi lo ka punji lo sovda vau lo ka fetsi''' — ''This fish demonstrates its female sexuality by laying eggs.''
:'''i do seksi lo ka se asna vau lo ka ninmu''' — ''You took a sexy feminine pose.''
:'''i le tigni cu seksi lo ka dasni pa tordu skaci vau lo ka ninmu''' — ''The actor shows her female sexuality by wearing a short skirt.''
:Related words: {gletu}, {nakpinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}

'''selbrivla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is a morphologically defined predicate word, verb word
:'''lo selbrivla''' — verb word. 
:'''i zo mlatu selbrivla''' — ''{mlatu} is a selbrivla.''
:Comment: {mlatu}, {e'ande}, {zildukse} are selbrivla.
:Related words: {lujvo}, {gismu}, {zi'evla}, {cmavo}
column16: is a morphologically defined predicate word, verb word
column25: {mlatu}, {e'ande}, {zildukse} are selbrivla.

column2:
'''selci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a cell, atom, basic subunit of body  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo selci''' — indivisible, cell, atom, basic subunit. 
:'''i mu'o nai do ro selci be lo xadni cu cmima pa lo so'i klesi''' — ''Furthermore, each cell in the body belongs to one out of many classes.''
:Comment: {kantu} allows to express properties of particles.
:Related words: {kantu}, {ratni}, {gradu}
column7: x1 cmarai lo spisa be x2 be'o poi ckaji be lo se ckaji be x2
column16: is a cell, atom, basic subunit of body
column25: {kantu} allows to express properties of particles.
column41: x1 is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of x2; x1 is an indivisible, most basic subunit of x2 ||| (x2 generally has mass nature); (cf. kantu for properties, activities; ratni, gradu)

column2:
'''selfu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  serves  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with service  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo selfu''' — servant. '''lo se selfu''' — master. '''lo te selfu''' — service. 
:'''i le gerku cu selfu mi lo ka bevri lo cutci''' — ''The dog serves me by bringing shoes.''
:Related words: {sidju}, {sarji}, {gunka}
column41: x1 (agent) serves x2 with service x3 (activity); x1 is a servant (noun) of x2 performing x3 ||| (cf. sidju, sarji, gunka)

column7: x1 suksa je se snuti lo ka se sance livbai lo vacri ja se vasxu lo nazbi jo'u lo moklu
column41: x1 sneezes (intransitive verb) ||| (cf. bilma, kafke)

column2:
'''senpi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  doubts that  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is true
:'''lo senpi''' — irresolute. 
:'''i mi senpi le du'u ba carvi''' — ''I doubt if it will rain.''
:'''i lo jalge ca'o se senpi''' — ''The result is still in doubt.''
:Related words: {jinvi}, {krici}, {djuno}, {birti}
column7: x1 no'e krici x2 .i x1 na'e birti x2
column41: x1 doubts/is dubious/doubtful/skeptical/questions that x2 (du'u) is true ||| [also: x2 is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= selsenpi for reordered places)]; (cf. jinvi, krici, djuno, birti)

column2:
'''senta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a layer of material  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  within structure  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo senta''' — layer. 
:'''i ti senta lo spati lo cmana jo'u lo vacri''' — ''This is a layer of plants between the mountain and the air.''
:Related words: {flu'ente}, {nenri}, {rirxe}, {sepli}, {snuji}, {jbini}, {bitmu}, {sruri}, {skalera}
column7: x1 marji x2 gi'e pagbu x3 gi'e rotsu tersei lo pagbu be x3 lo ve vimcu
column41: x1 is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of x2 [material] within structure/continuum/composite x3 ||| (cf. flecu, nenri, rirxe, sepli, snuji, jbini, bitmu, sruri, serti)

column2:
'''senva''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  dreams about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>'' 
:'''lo senva''' — dreamer. '''lo se senva''' — dream. 
:'''i mi senva lo nu mi vofli ne'i lo dilnu''' — ''I dream about flying in the clouds.''
:'''i mi senva tu'a lo sance be lo carvi''' — ''I dream the sound of rain.''
:Related words: {sipna}, {xanri}
column7: x1 se xanri x2 fau lo nu x1 sipna ja nalju'i
column41: x1 dreams about/that x2 (fact/idea/event/state); x2 is a dream/reverie of x1 ||| [dream/reverie (= selsne)]; (cf. sipna, xanri)

column2:
'''sepli''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is separate from  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  , separated by  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sepli''' — separate, alone. 
:'''i zo i te sepli lo jufra lo jufra''' — ''{i} separates sentence from sentence.''
:'''i lo briju pe mi cu sepli lo zdani be mi zo'ei ze'a lo cacra''' — ''My office is one hour away from my home.''
:'''i lo xamsi ti ma sepli''' — ''What is the distance to the sea?''
:Related words: {bitmu}, {snuji}, {senta}, {fendi}, {curve}, {jinsa}, {bitmu}, {marbi}
column7: x3 ni x1 zvada'o x2
column41: x1 is apart/separate from x2, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium x3 ||| [also aloof (= jiksei); alone (= rolsmisei meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; pavysei, seirpavmei meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); x3 space]; (cf. bitmu, snuji, senta, fendi, curve, jinsa, bitmu, marbi)

column16: reflects USSR, Soviet Union, Soviet culture, Soviet nationality in

column2:
'''setca''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  inserts or puts  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  into  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se setca''' — inserted. 
:'''i le mikce cu setca pa jesni pa birka be la alis se gau lo nu le xukmi cu muvdu lo ciblu''' — ''The doctor inserted the needle into Alice's arm so that the chemical got into the blood.''
:Related words: {rinci}, {tisna}, {punji}, {jbini}, {nenri}, {jmina}, {culno}, {kunti}, {catlu}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 nenri x3
column41: x1 (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits x2 into interior x3/into among/between members of x3 ||| [insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= je'erse'a); syringe/needle (= se'arterje'e, je'erse'atci, jestu'u or tu'urjesni); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill]; (cf. rinci, tisna, punji, jbini, nenri, jmina, culno, kunti, catlu)

column2:
'''sevzi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a self of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity: by default x1)</sub>'' 
:'''i mi lumci lo sevzi''' — ''I wash myself.''
:Comment: {sevzi} is usually used in lujvo. Outside lujvo {lo} {nei} is usually used instead.
:Related words: {mi}, {prenu}, {menli}, {jgira}
column7: x1 noi prenu cu du x2
column25: {sevzi} is usually used in lujvo. Outside lujvo {lo} {nei} is usually used instead.
column41: x1 is a self/ego/id/identity-image of x2 ||| (cf. cmavo list mi, prenu, menli, jgira)

column2:
'''sfani''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a fly of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sfani''' — fly (insect). 
:'''i xu lo vi sfani cu ckape''' — ''Are these flies dangerous?''
:Related words: {cinki}, {bifce}
column41: x1 is a fly [a small non-stinging flying insect] of species/breed x2 ||| (cf. cinki, bifce)

column2:
'''sfasa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  punishes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  with punishment  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sfasa''' — punished. '''lo te sfasa''' — reason for punishment. '''lo ve sfasa''' — punishment. 
:'''i le rirni pu sfasa le verba lo ka jai gau spofu fai lo palta vau lo ka na e'ande vo'e lo ka kelci bu'u lo zdani''' — ''The parent punished the child for breaking the plate by not allowing playing at home.''
:Related words: {cnemu}, {pleji}, {venfu}, {zekri}, {canja}, {dunda}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {dapma}, {cirko}, {jinga}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 malfri x4 kei mu'i lo nu x2 zukte x3 noi zekri ja palci ja xlali
column41: x1 (agent) punishes x2 for infraction x3 (event/state/action) with punishment x4 (event/state) ||| [also chastise, castigate, chasten, discipline, correct (one sense); also x4 penalty]; (cf. cnemu, pleji, venfu, zekri, canja, dunda, jdima, jerna, kargu, prali, dapma, cirko, jinga)

column2:
'''sfofa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a sofa
:'''lo sfofa''' — sofa. 
:'''i au mi te vecnu lo pa sfofa''' — ''I would like to buy a sofa.''
:Related words: {nilce}
column7: x1 nilce fi lo ka se zutse za'u prenu .i x1 clani stizu .i x1 se rixpau lo ka'e se vreta be lo zutse
column41: x1 is a sofa/couch (noun) ||| (cf. nilce)

column2:
'''sfubu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  dives or swoops to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  from  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sfubu''' — diver. 
:'''i mi pu sfubu lo lenku djacu lo korbi be lo lalxu''' — ''I dived to the cold water from the shore of the lake.''
:Related words: {farlu}
column41: x1 dives/swoops [manner of controlled falling] to x2 from x3 ||| (cf. farlu, farlu)

column2:
'''siclu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  whistles sound  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(sound, text)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se siclu''' — whistled. 
:'''i le nakni pu ca'o siclu lo cladu''' — ''He was whistling something loud.''
:Related words: {sance}, {tonga}, {sanga}, {zgike}, {savru}
column7: x1 se sance x2 noi brato'a gi'a porsi lo brato'a ta'i mu'a lo nu livbai lo vacri lo moklu lo cmalu kalri noi jalge lo nu jbisimgau lo ctebi .a lo denci
column41: x1 [sound source] whistles/makes whistling sound/note/tone/melody x2 ||| (cf. sance, tonga, sanga, zgike, savru)

column2:
'''sicni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a coin ...
:'''lo sicni''' — coin. 
:'''i ti me lo sicni poi jdini loi fraso turni''' — ''This is a coin issued by French government.''
:'''i mi pu cpacu ci lo sicni poi rupnu li pa''' — ''I got three coins one dollar each in value.''
:Related words: {fepni}, {jdini}, {rupnu}
column41: x1 is a coin/token/is specie issued by x2 having value x3 of composition including x4 ||| (cf. fepni, jdini, rupnu)

column2:
'''sidbo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>''  is an idea about  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  by thinker  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sidbo''' — idea. 
:'''i mi pu na te sidbo do lo ka se la'u li xo kau ka'e xendo mi''' — ''I had no idea of how kind to me you can be.''
:Related words: {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, {si'o}
column5: _-Also (adjective:) x1 is ideal/ideational. See also {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, cmavo list {si'o}.
column6: _+See also {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, cmavo list {si'o}.
column7: x1 noi mucti cu srana x2 gi'e se pensi x3
column41: x1 (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about x2 (object/abstract) by thinker x3 ||| [also (adjective:) x1 is ideal/ideational]; (cf. ciksi, jijnu, mucti, jinvi, nabmi, pensi, xanri, cmavo list si'o)

column2:
'''sidju''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  helps  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  do  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sidju''' — helper. 
:'''i pei e'o do sidju mi lo ka tadni lo cmaci''' — ''Could you help me in studying math?''
:Related words: {si'u}, {rirni}, {sarji}, {vipsi}, {ferti}, {selfu}
column7: x1 dunda ja sabji fi x2 fe lo se nitcu be x2 bei x3 .i x1 gasnu lo nu x3 jdika lo ka nandu x2 kei gi'a zenba lo ka frili x2 .i x1 to'e zunti lo nu x2 ckaji ja zukte x3
column41: x1 helps/assists/aids object/person x2 do/achieve/maintain event/activity x3 ||| (cf. cmavo list si'u, rirni, sarji, vipsi, ferti, selfu)

column2:
'''sigja''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a cigar or cigarette ...
:'''lo sigja''' — cigar, cigarette. 
:'''i xu le smani ca'o damva'u lo sigja''' — ''Is the monkey smoking a cigarette?''
:Related words: {danmo}, {jelca}, {tanko}, {marna}
column41: x1 is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance x2 by x3 ||| (cf. danmo, jelca, tanko, marna)

column2:
'''silka''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a silk produced by  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo silka''' — silk. 
:'''i la alis pu dasni pa silka pastu''' — ''Alice was wearing a silk dress.''
:'''i lo silka be lo ankabuta ka'e tsali''' — ''Spider's silk can be durable.''
:Related words: {curnu}, {bukpu}, {cilta}
column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by x2 ||| (cf. curnu, bukpu, cilta)

column2:
'''silna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is some salt, NaCl ...
:'''lo silna''' — salt. 
:'''i e'o ko te cpacu lo silna mi''' — ''Please, pass me the salt.''
:'''i lo silna be lo sodna cu cidja''' — ''A salt of Sodium is a food.''
:Related words: {sakta}
column41: x1 is a portion/quantity of salt from source x2, of composition including x3 ||| (cf. sakta)

column2:
'''simlu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  seems to have  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  to observer  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''i mi te simlu fi do fe lo ka se la'u li du'e tadni''' — ''It seems to me that you are studying too hard.''
:'''i le nu troci pu simlu lo ka na sarcu''' — ''The attempt seemed to be unnecessary.''
:Related words: {catlu}, {viska}, {simsa}, {zgana}, {ganse}, {jarco}
column7: lo nu x1 ckaji x2 kei noi ka'e na fatci ja satci cu se ganse x3
column41: x1 seems/appears to have property(ies) x2 to observer x3 under conditions x4 ||| [also: x1 seems like it has x2 to x3; suggest belief/observation (= mlugau, mluti'i); looks like/resembles (= smimlu, mitmlu)]; (cf. catlu, viska, simsa, zgana, ganse, jarco)

column2:
'''simsa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is similar to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1 and x2 with {kau})</sub>'' 
:'''lo simsa''' — similar. 
:'''i lo skapi be le ninmu pu simsa lo snime lo ka blabi''' — ''Her skin was white as snow.''
:'''i mi simsa lo'e cipni lo ka zifre''' — ''I am free as a bird.''
:'''i do simsa fi so'i da fe lo mensi be mi''' — ''You are a lot like my sister.''
:'''i pa pendo be mi mi simsa lo ka xabju ma kau i pa pendo be mi mi jibni lo ka xabju ma kau''' — ''My friend and I live in similar apartments. My friend and I live nearby.''
:Comment: {jibni} is used when the difference is something generally measurable, whereas {simsa} is about difference in quality.
:Related words: {dunli}, {frica}, {mintu}, {panra}, {simlu}, {vrici}
column7: x1 toltce lo ka frica x2 x3
column25: {jibni} is used when the difference is something generally measurable, whereas {simsa} is about difference in quality.
column34: property of x1 and x2 with {kau}
column41: x1 is similar/parallel to x2 in property/quantity x3 (ka/ni); x1 looks/appears like x2 ||| [also: x1 is a likeness/image of x2; x1 and x2 are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis]; (cf. dunli, frica, mintu, panra, simlu, vrici)

column2:
'''simxu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>''  mutually do  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(relation between members of x1, contains two places for {ce'u})</sub>'' 
:'''lo se simxu''' — done mutually. 
:'''i do jo'u mi simxu lo ka prami''' — ''You and I love each other.''
:Related words: {kampu}, {mintu}
column3: -x1 (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally x2 (event [x1 should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]).
column4: _+x1 mutually/reciprocally are/do x2 (binary ka).
column5: _-Members of x1 do to each other/one another x2, and in return do x2; x1 (plural set) do the same thing x2 to each other. See also {kampu}, {mintu}.
column6: _+x1 do x2 to each other; x1 are each other's x2. See also {kampu}, {mintu}.
column7: ro da poi me x1 cu ckini ro me x1 poi na du da ku'o x2 .i rau da poi me x1 cu ckini rau me x1 poi na du da ku'o x2
column33: relation between members of x1, contains two places for {ce'u}
column41: x1 (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally x2 (event [x1 should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]) ||| [members of x1 do to each other/one another x2, and in return do x2; x1 (plural set) do the same thing x2 to each other]; (cf. kampu, mintu)

column2:
'''since''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a snake of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo since''' — snake. 
:'''i ko na terpa lo since''' — ''Don't be afraid of snakes.''
:Related words: {curnu}, {danlu}, {respa}, {vindu}
column7: x1 re'ucti gi'e se tuple no da gi'e respa x2 noi jutsi la'o xy. Serpentes .xy
column41: x1 is a snake/serpent of species/breed x2 ||| (cf. curnu, danlu, respa, vindu)

column2:
'''sinma''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  respects  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sinma''' — respected, venerated. 
:'''i no prije cu se sinma lo se gugde be lo gugde be vo'a''' — ''No wise man is respected by inhabitants of his own country.''
:Related words: {banli}, {censa}, {misno}, {nelci}, {prami}, {salci}, {jgira}
column7: x1 cinmo lo zabna x2 .i x1 jinvi lo du'u x2 banli
column41: x1 esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards x2 [object of respect] ||| [also: x2 is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= selsi'a for reordered places)]; (cf. banli, censa, misno, nelci, prami, salci, jgira)

column2:
'''sinso''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(number)</sub>''  is the trigonometric sine of angle  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(number)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sinso''' — sine. 
:'''i li no sinso lo radno be li pai''' — ''0 is the sine of "pi" radians.''
:Related words: {tanjo}
column7: x1 parbi ko'a noi x2 jganu ko'e ke'a ku'o ko'i .i je ko'a sraji tersei lo pinta linji be ko'e lo te kruca be ko'a bei ko'o noi cukla gi'e se midju ko'e .i je ko'i tersei ko'e ko'o
column16: is the trigonometric sine of angle
column41: x1 is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine x2 ||| (cf. tanjo)

column2:
'''sinxa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity, text)</sub>''  is a sign meaning  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  to observer  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sinxa''' — sign. '''lo se sinxa''' — meaning of a sign. 
:'''i fi lo karce e lo cadzu fa lo xunre gusni cu sinxa lo ka bilga lo ka co'u muvdu''' — ''For cars and pedestrians red light is a sign that they must stop.''
:Related words: {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}
column5: _-Also: x1 signifies x2; (adjective:) x1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}). See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.
column6: _+Also: x1 signifies x2; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}). See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.
column7: x1 noi dacti ja fasnu ja morna ja barna ja lerfu ja tcita cu se smuni x2 x3 gi'a krati x2 lo ka se pilno x3 lo ka benji lo sidbo
column37: represent (serve as a sign or signal for) [to]
column41: x1 is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning x2 to observer x3 ||| [also: x1 signifies x2; (adjective:) x1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= sniti'i), connotation (= se sibyti'isni, sibyti'ismu)]; (cf. lerfu, tcita, barna, mifra, smuni)

column2:
'''sipna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is asleep, sleeps
:'''lo sipna''' — asleep. 
:'''i le verba ca'o sipna''' — ''The child is sleeping.''
:Related words: {senva}, {tatpi}, {cikna}, {sanji}
column3: -x1 is asleep (adjective); x1 sleeps/is sleeping.
column4: _+x1 is asleep.
column7: x1 surla lo ka na'e zukte gi'e mulno ja nalmu'o lo ka na'e sanji .i x1 to'e cikna
column41: x1 is asleep (adjective); x1 sleeps/is sleeping ||| (cf. senva, tatpi, cikna, sanji)

column2:
'''sirji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is straight or direct between  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo sirji''' — straight, direct (straight). 
:'''i le dargu cu sirji lo snanu jo'u lo berti''' — ''The road goes straight from the south to the north.''
:Related words: {korcu}, {linji}, {kuspe}
column3: -x1 is straight/direct/line segment/interval between x2 and x3; (adjective:) x1 is linear.
column4: _+x1 is straight/direct/line segment/interval between x2 and x3.
column7: x1 toryrai lo linji be x2 e x3
column41: x1 is straight/direct/line segment/interval between x2 and x3; (adjective:)  x1 is linear ||| (cf. korcu, linji, kruvi, kuspe)

column3: -x1 seeks/searches/looks for property x2 among set x3 (complete specification of set).
column4: _+x1 seeks/searches/looks for property x2 among individuals x3.
column7: x1 zukte da lo nu x1 facki lo du'u ma kau poi me x3 cu ckaji x2
column41: x1 seeks/searches/looks for property x2 among set x3 (complete specification of set) ||| [if searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in x2]; (cf. cirko, kalte, kavbu, kucli, rivbi, manci, facki)

column2:
'''sisti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ceases or stops  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sisti''' — ceased, stopped. 
:'''i ko sisti lo ka bebna tavla''' — ''Stop babbling!''
:Related words: {fanmo}, {mulno}, {cfari}, {denpa}, {fliba}
column7: x1 co'u zukte ja ckaji x2 .i lo nu x1 zukte ja ckaji x2 cu tolcfa
column37: cease [to], stop [to], halt (come to a halt) [to]
column41: x1 [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state x2 [not necessarily completing it] ||| (cf. fanmo, mulno, cfari, denpa, fliba)

column2:
'''sitna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  quotes or cites source  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for statement  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sitna''' — quoted source. 
:'''i lu le mamta nu'o tsuku le zdani li'u fi mi te sitna la alis''' — ''"Mother is not yet at home", I quoted Alice.''
:Related words: {krasi}
column7: x1 refsku lo se cusku be x2 fi'o datni x3
column41: x1 cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source x2 for information/statement x3 (du'u) ||| (cf. krasi)

column2:
'''sivni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is private, personal to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sivni''' — private. 
:'''i lo tadji be lo nu zbasu lo poi tai kukte vau stasu cu sivni mi''' — ''How to make such a tasty soup is a secret to me.''
:Related words: {gubni}, {mipri}
column7: x1 srana x2 noi prenu ku'o .e no drata be x2 .i x1 to'e gubni lo drata be x2

column41: x1 is old/familiar/well-known to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4 ||| [This can cover both meanings of old.  Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through x2 = the world, life, existence (= loi nu zasti); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis.  However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= nalci'o, tolci'o), but the opposite of 'new' (= tolni'o); also ancient (= tcesau), age (= nilsau); x2 is used to x1 (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= cirsau, cirselcedra; also vaipru)]; (cf. clani, citno, cnino, se djuno; not the opposite of citno, djuno)

column4: _+x1 adheres/sticks to x2.
column41: x1 adheres/sticks to x2; (adjective:) x1 is sticky/gummy/adhesive ||| [note that x1 is the adhering surface being claimed; x2 need not be sticky]; (cf. tarla, viknu)

column2:
'''snuji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a sandwich of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  sandwiched between  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity group)</sub>'' 
:'''lo snuji''' — sandwich. 
:'''i mi pu citka pa snuji be lo rectu bei lo nanba''' — ''I ate a bread sandwich with meat inside.''
:Related words: {midju}, {nenri}, {sepli}, {senta}, {jbini}, {bitmu}, {sruri}
column41: x1 is a sandwich/layering [not restricted to food] of x2 sandwiched between x3 ||| (cf. midju, nenri, sepli, senta, jbini, bitmu, sruri)

column2:
'''snura''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is safe from threat  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo snura''' — safe from a threat. 
:'''i mi'o snura lo ka se gunta lo bramlatu''' — ''We are safe from a possible attack of big cats.''
:Related words: {ckape}, {kajde}, {marbi}, {terpa}, {xalni}, {bandu}
column7: x1 se marbi ja se bandu fi x2 ja'e lo nu na lakne fa lo nu x1 ba se xrani x2 .i x1 ka'e je nai ca'a se ckape x2
column41: x1 is secure/safe from threat x2 (event) ||| (cf. ckape, kajde, marbi, terpa, xalni, bandu)

column2:
'''snuti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''  is an accident on the part of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo snuti''' — accident. 
:'''i lo ka darxi la alis pu to'e snuti la kevin''' — ''It was deliberate on the part of Kevin to hit Alice.''
:'''i le ka srera pu snuti le lanli''' — ''The error happened accidentally on the part of the researcher.''
:Related words: {zukte}, {cunso}
column7: x1 to'e se zukte x2 zi'o zi'o
column16: is an accident on the part of
column41: x1 (event/state) is an accident/unintentional on the part of x2; x1 is an accident ||| (cf. zukte, cunso)

column2:

:'''lo sobde''' — soya. 
:'''i ti stasu lo sobde''' — ''This is a soya soup.''
:Related words: {dembi}, {gurni}
column7: x1 dembi ja spati x2 noi jutsi la'o jutsi Glycine max jutsi
column41: x1 is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain x2 ||| (cf. dembi, gurni)

column2:
'''sodna''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a quantity of alkali metal ...
:'''lo sodna''' — alkali metal. 
:'''i la natriium cu sodna''' — ''Sodium (Na) is an alkali metal.''

column7: x1 jilka je jinme cmuxu'i
column16: is a quantity of alkali metal
column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type x2 [default sodium] ||| [also potassium, lithium, cesium]; [soda] (cf. jilka, jinme)

column2:
'''sodva''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a quantity of soda, carbonated beverage of brand  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sodva''' — soda. 
:'''i mi pu pinxe lo sodva be lo bisli kruji''' — ''I was drinking an ice cream soda.''
:Related words: {jilka}, {jinme}
column7: x1 tabrelkijno ricfu selpinxe gi'e se vrusi x2
column16: is a quantity of soda, carbonated beverage of brand
column41: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of a carbonated beverage/soda of flavor/brand x2 ||| [also: soft drink (though this sometimes includes tea and coffee as distinct from alcoholic beverages which are "hard drinks")]; (cf. jilka, jinme)

column2:
'''solji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a quantity of gold
:'''lo solji''' — gold. 
:'''i lo solji cu kargu''' — ''Gold is expensive.''
:'''i lo letri te jorne poi lo solji cu sefta cu xe benji se la'u li rau''' — ''Electrical junctions with gold surfaces are good transmitters.''

column41: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of gold (Au); [metaphor: valuable, heavy, non-reactive] ||| (cf. ricfu, rijno, narju, pelxu)

column2:
'''solri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the sun of home planet  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo solri''' — sun. 
:'''i ti solri so'o barda planeta''' — ''This is a home star of several big planets.''
:Related words: {gusni}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {planeta}, {santa}, {terdi}, {tarci}
column3: -x1 is the sun of home planet x2 (default Earth) of race x3; (adjective:) x1 is solar.

column16: is the sun of home planet
column41: x1 is the sun of home planet x2 (default Earth) of race x3; (adjective:) x1 is solar ||| ['home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds]; (cf. gusni, lunra, mluni, plini, santa, terdi, tarci)

column2:
'''sombo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  sows  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sombo''' — sown. 
:'''i xu do mo'u sombo le tsiju lo dertu''' — ''Have you sown the seeds in the ground?''
:Related words: {crepu}, {tsiju}
column7: x1 punji x2 noi tsiju ku'o x3 noi tumla ja dertu ku'o te zu'e lo nu x2 banro
column41: x1 sows/plants x2 [crop/plants] at/in x3 ||| (cf. crepu, tsiju)

column2:
'''sonci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a soldier of army  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sonci''' — soldier. '''lo se sonci''' — army of soldiers. 
:'''i ti se sonci pa ki'o ji'i da''' — ''This is an army of approximately 1000 soldiers.''
:Related words: {damba}, {jenmi}, {xarci}, {pulji}
column7: x1 cmima x2 noi jenmi
column41: x1 is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army x2 ||| (cf. bilni, damba, jenmi, xarci, pulji)

column2:
'''sorcu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a store or deposit of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo sorcu''' — store, deposit, stockpile. 
:'''i ei mi klama lo sorcu be lo cidja''' — ''I should go to a food store.''
:'''i xu le sorcu be lo datni cu akti''' — ''Is the data store active?''
:Comment: {vreji} is @@@record of information@@@ or @@@computer file@@@, {lo} {sorcu} is bound to a location, {lo} {se} {sabji} is @@@stored, reserved@@@ that is not necessarily tied to a location.
:Related words: {banxa}, {panka}
column7: x1 gunma x2 noi denpa lo ka se pilno kei lo ka se vasru ja zvati x3
column16: is a store or deposit of
column25: {vreji} is @@@record of information@@@ or @@@computer file@@@, {lo} {sorcu} is bound to a location, {lo} {se} {sabji} is @@@stored, reserved@@@ that is not necessarily tied to a location.
column41: x1 is a store/deposit/supply/reserve of materials/energy x2 in containment x3 ||| [x3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap.  The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x2 that are not part of the store]; (cf. panka; vreji for information storage; sabji for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, banxa, panka)

column2:
'''sorgu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is sorghum of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sorgu''' — sorghum. 
:'''i ra pu jai gau farvi fai lo sorgu te zu'e lo ka jai gau citka lo jipci''' — ''He was growing sorghum to feed chickens.''
:Related words: {gurni}
column7: x1 gurni ja spati x2 noi jutsi la'o jutsi Sorghum bicolor jutsi
column41: x1 is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain x2 ||| (cf. gurni)

column2:
'''sorta''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  sorta is/does  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sorta''' — sorta, sort of. 
:'''i mi sorta lo ka gleki''' — ''I'm sort of happy.''
:Related words: {simsa}, {klesi}

'''sovda''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an egg or pollen from organism  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sovda''' — egg. 
:'''i mi pu lebna so'o sovda be lo jipci''' — ''I took several hen eggs.''
:Comment: {sovda} is @@@pollen@@@, {tsiju} is @@@spore@@@ or @@@embryo-containing egg@@@. Hen eggs used as food are usually unfertilized and thus are {sovda}.
:Related words: {ganti}, {gutra}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {rorci}, {lanbi}, {tarbi}
column16: is an egg or pollen from organism
column25: {sovda} is @@@pollen@@@, {tsiju} is @@@spore@@@ or @@@embryo-containing egg@@@. Hen eggs used as food are usually unfertilized and thus are {sovda}.
column41: x1 is an egg/ovum/sperm/pollen/gamete of/from organism [mother/father] x2 ||| [(poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= pevyso'aseltai, but better: claboi); egg, specifically female (= fetso'a), of a bird (= cpifetso'a, cpiso'a), of a chicken (= jipcyfetso'a, jipcyso'a] (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); [if fertilized, then tsiju or tarbi]; (cf. ganti, gutra, mamta, patfu, rorci, tsiju, lanbi, tarbi; also djine, konju for shape, tarbi)

column2:
'''spaji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(clause)</sub>''  surprises  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo spaji''' — surprising event. '''lo se spaji''' — surprised. 
:'''i mi se spaji lo nu do kakne lo ka zgipli lo tabra''' — ''I am surprised that you can play the horn.''
:Related words: {marvele}, {jenca}, {bredi}, {suksa}
column7: x1 fasnu gi'e na se kanpe x2
column41: x1 (event/action abstract) surprises/startles/is unexpected [and generally sudden] to x2 ||| [also expectation (= nalspaji), alarm (= tepspaji)]; (cf. manci, jenca, bredi, suksa)

column2:
'''spali''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  polishes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with polish  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo te spali''' — polish. 
:'''i le ninmu cu spali lo xadni be vo'a lo cakla''' — ''The woman polished her body with a chocolate.''
:Related words: {mosra}, {sraku}, {xutla}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 xutla je carmi kei ta'i lo nu x1 punji je mosra x3 x2
column41: x1 (agent) polishes object/surface x2 with polish x3, applied using tool x4 ||| (cf. mosra, sraku, xutla)

column2:
'''spano''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is Spanish in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo spano''' — Spanish. 
:'''i xu le ninmu cu spano''' — ''Is she Spanish?''

column7: x1 ckini lo kulnu ja bangu ja cecmu ja natmi pe lo bansupu'a ja gugde'esu x2
column41: x1 reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect x2 ||| [metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= sangu'e); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= sansanbau)]; (cf. xispo, ketco, mexno, gento)

column2:

:'''i le spati cu banro''' — ''The plant is growing.''

column6: _+See also {genja}, {grute}, {gurni}, {latna}, {rozgu}, {stagi}, {tricu}, {tsiju}, {tujli}, {xruba}, {xrula}, {pezli}, {srasu}.
column41: x1 is a plant/herb/greenery of species/strain/cultivar x2 ||| [also (adjective:) x1 is vegetable/vegetal/vegetative]; (cf. genja, grute, gurni, latna, rozgu, stagi, tricu, tsiju, tujli, xruba, xrula, pezli, srasu)

column2:
'''speni''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is married to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  under custom  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(proposition)</sub>'' ; x<sub>1</sub> is a spouse of x<sub>2</sub>

column41: x1 is married to x2; x1 is a spouse of x2 under law/custom/tradition/system/convention x3 ||| (cf. prami, gletu)

column2:
'''spisa''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a portion or piece of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

:'''i ko sabji lo pa spisa be lo plise mi''' — ''Give me a piece of an apple.''

'''spita''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a hospital treating patient  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  for condition  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x2)</sub>''

column2:
'''spofu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is broken in function  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo spofu''' — broken. '''lo se spofu''' — broken function. 
:'''i le molki cu spofu lo ka cupra lo purmo''' — ''The mill is broken and is not producing the flour.''

column7: x1 na ka'e akti x2
column41: x1 is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function x2 ||| [agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= pofygau, pofyzu'e); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= pofyja'e, nutpo'uja'e)]; (cf. daspo, katna, porpi, se xrani, cikre)

column2:
'''spoja''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  explodes or bursts into pieces  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo spoja''' — exploding. 
:'''i le jbama pu spoja lo pagbu''' — ''The bomb exploded into pieces.''
:Related words: {porpi}, {pagbu}, {cecla}, {jakne}, {jbama}

column41: x1 bursts/explodes/violently breaks up/decomposes/combusts into pieces/energy/fragments x2 ||| (cf. cecla, jakne, jbama)

column2:
'''spuda''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  responds or answers to stimulus  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  with response  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo spuda''' — responder. '''lo se spuda''' — stimulus for a response. '''lo te spuda''' — response. 
:'''i mi pu spuda lo se retsku lo ka spusku zo je'u''' — ''I responded to the question by replying "Yes."''
:'''i le prenu pu spuda lo se friti be le fetsi lo ka cmila''' — ''The person responded to her offer with laughter.''
:'''i le skami na spuda''' — ''The computer is not responding.''
:Related words: {cusku}, {retsku}, {nabmi}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}
column7: x1 frati fi x2 fe lo ka zukte x3
column41: x1 answers/replies to/responds to person/object/event/situation/stimulus x2 with response x3 ||| [x3 also answer/reply]; [if x2 is a person/object, it will usually require "tu'a" indicating that the reply/response is to that person/object doing something.  "tu'a" may not be needed if the person/object itself is the stimulus, rather than something it is doing];(cf. cusku, preti, nabmi, danfu, frati, cpedu)

column7: x1 livgau x2 noi na'o litki se cigla lo moklu

column2:
'''sraji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is vertical in reference frame  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sraji''' — vertical. 
:'''i le grana cu simlu lo ka sraji mi''' — ''The rod seems to be standing vertically from my position.''

column41: x1 is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity x2 ||| (cf. sanli, pinta)

column2:
'''sraku''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  scratches  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sraku''' — abrasive, cutting (abrasive), scratching. '''lo se sraku''' — scratched. 
:'''i mi pu sraku lo stedu be mi''' — ''I scratched my head.''
:Comment: {sraku} does not imply that material is removed, {kakpa} implies that, though.
:Related words: {guska}, {katna}, {mosra}, {plixa}, {kakpa}, {spali}
column25: {sraku} does not imply that material is removed, {kakpa} implies that, though.
column41: x1 [abrasive/cutting/scratching object/implement] scratches/[carves]/erodes/cuts [into] x2 ||| (cf. guska, katna, mosra, plixa, kakpa (unlike kakpa, sraku does not imply material is removed), spali)

column2:
'''sralo''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is Australian in  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sralo''' — Australian. 
:'''i xu tu noi nixli cu sralo''' — ''Is that girl Australian?''
:Related words: {glico}
column7: x1 ckini lo kulnu ja bangu ja cecmu ja natmi pe lo gugde'a'u x2
column41: x1 reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect x2 ||| (cf. glico)

column2:
'''srana''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is relevant to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo srana''' — relevant. 
:'''i e'o do ciska lo srana be lo fatci se lifri be do''' — ''Please write about related to your real experience.''
:'''i xu le nu do litru cu srana lo jibri be do''' — ''Is your journey a business trip?''
:Related words: {ckini}, {ponse}, {steci}
column7: x1 sruri ja jibni x2 lo ka se pensi .i x1 datni ja sidbo ja lisri ja velski ja velcki ja nuzba ja notci ja pixra ja skina ja draci ja cfika ja prosa ja pemci li'o x2 .i x1 se djuno ja se krici ja se jinvi ja se jijnu ja se sruma ja se smadi ja se facki ja se jimpe ja se cilre li'o fi x2
column41: x1 pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about x2 ||| [also: x1 is a question of/treats of x2; can be symmetric, although x1 is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than x2]; (cf. cmavo list ra'a, ckini, ponse, steci)

column2:
'''srasu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a blade of grass of species  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(taxon)</sub>'' 
:'''lo srasu''' — blade of grass. 
:'''i lo bakni cu nitcu lo srasu''' — ''Cows need grass.''
:Comment: @@@expanse of grass@@@ is {loi srasu}.
:Related words: {spati}
column16: is a blade of grass of species
column25: @@@expanse of grass@@@ is {loi srasu}.
column41: x1 is a blade/expanse of grass of species x2 ||| [lawn/meadow (= sasfoi)]; (cf. spati)

column2:
'''srera''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  errs in doing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  ...
:'''lo se srera''' — error, mistake. 
:'''i mi pu srera lo ka cuxna ma kau noi speni mi''' — ''I made a mistake in choosing my spouse.''
:'''i mi pu srera lo ka klama la madrid''' — ''I made a mistake by going to Madrid.''
:Comment: when using {kau} x<sub>2</sub> can specify the actual act considered an error.
:Related words: {drani}, {cfila}, {fliba}
column7: x1 na'e drani lo ka zukte ja ckaji x2
column25: when using {kau} x<sub>2</sub> can specify the actual act considered an error.
column41: x1 errs in doing/being/making mistake x2 (event), an error under conditions x3 by standard x4 ||| (cf. drani, which is non-agentive, cfila, fliba)

column2:
'''sruma''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  assumes that  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  is true about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se sruma''' — assumed. 
:'''i mi sruma lo nu racli vau lo nu ca'o smaji''' — ''I think it'd be rational to continue keeping silence.''
:Related words: {smadi}, {birti}
column7: x1 pensi se cau lo jicmu lo du'u x2 noi srana x3 cu jetnu kei te zu'e lo mu'a ka lanli lo du'u x2 nibli ma kau
column41: x1 assumes/supposes that x2 (du'u) is true about subject x3; [epistemology] ||| [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; (cf. smadi, birti)

column2:
'''sruri''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  encloses or surrounds  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in direction  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo sruri''' — enclosing. '''lo se sruri''' — enclosed. 
:'''i le ckule cu se sruri lo cmana joi lo lalxu lo ro korbi''' — ''The school is surrounded by mountains and lakes from all sides.''
:Related words: {karli}, {senta}, {snuji}, {vanbi}, {se} {nenri}, {se} {jbini}, {bartu}, {djine}
column41: x1 encircles/encloses/is surrounding x2 in direction(s)/dimension(s)/plane x3 ||| [(jinsru =) x1 is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing x2 near total containment in some dimension(s)]; (cf. karli, senta, snuji, vanbi, se nenri, se jbini, bartu, djine)

column2:
'''stace''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is honest with  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo stace''' — honest. 
:'''i ko stace mi lo ka pu smusku lo nu do pu zukte ma kau''' — ''Be honest with me in saying what you did.''
:'''i sei mi stace mi na djuno''' — ''Frankly, I don't know.''
:'''i sei mi stace na vajni mi''' — ''Frankly, it's not important to me.''
:Related words: {tcica}, {jetnu}, {jitfa}, {mipri}
column7: x1 na jifsku fi x2 gi'e na zukte fi lo tcica be x2 bei lo ka ce'u jinvi ja krici lo jitfa x3 noi ke'a jetnu .i x1 to'e mipri fi x2 fe x3
column41: x1 is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with x2 about matter/fact x3 ||| [also straight, straight-forward]; (cf. tcica, jetnu, jitfa, mipri)

column2:
'''stagi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is an edible part of plant ...
:'''i au stasu lo stagi''' — ''I'd like a vegetable soup.''
:'''i ti noi genja cu patlu stagi''' — ''This root is a vegetable of potato plant.''
:Comment: includes edible fruits, vegetables, seeds, roots, leaves, stems, flowers, buds.
:Related words: {grute}, {kobli}, {narge}, {sluni}, {spati}, {sunga}, {tamca}

column25: includes edible fruits, vegetables, seeds, roots, leaves, stems, flowers, buds.
column41: x1 is the edible x2 portion of plant x3; x1 is a vegetable ||| [note that fruits and nuts are also vegetables; generally this word will be used for either the general category of edible plants, or for non-fruit vegetables (= nalrutstagi)]; (cf. grute, kobli, narge, sluni, spati, sunga, tamca)

column2:

column2:

column41: x1 feels frustration about x2 (abstraction) ||| (cf. cinmo)

column2:
'''steci''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(property of x2 and x3)</sub>''  is specific only to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  among  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' ; x<sub>2</sub> is the only one, are the only ones being or doing x<sub>1</sub> among x<sub>3</sub>
:'''lo steci''' — specific feature. '''lo se steci''' — having a specific feature. 
:'''i fi lo jmive fa lo remna cu se steci lo ka pilno lo xislu''' — ''Among living beings, only humans use wheel.''
:Related words: {po'e}, {srana}, {se} {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}
column3: -x1 (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of x2 among x3 (set).
column4: _+x1 (ka) is a defining property of x2 among x3. x2 are the only ones among x3 that have property x1.
column5: _-[x2 are members/individuals of a subset of x3; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= tecra'a, also cf. cmavo list po'e, [x2 is also special to x1]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; (x3 is completely specified set)]; See also {srana}, se {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}.
column6: _+See also {srana}, se {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}.
column7: ge x2 me x3 gi ge ro me x2 ckaji x1 gi no da poi me x3 gi'e na me x2 cu ckaji x1
column24: x<sub>2</sub> is the only one, are the only ones being or doing x<sub>1</sub> among x<sub>3</sub>
column41: x1 (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of x2 among x3 (set) ||| [x2 are members/individuals of a subset of x3; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= tecra'a, also cf. cmavo list po'e, [x2 is also special to x1]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; (x3 is completely specified set)]; (cf. srana, se ponse, ckini, tcila, tutra)

column2:
'''stedu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a head of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo stedu''' — head.

column7: x1 pagbu lo xadni be x2 gi'e jorne lo cutne lo cnebo gi'e vasru lo besna jo'u lo kanla jo'u lo kerlo jo'u lo nazbi jo'u lo moklu

column2:
'''stela''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a lock for sealing  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  , with mechanism  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>'' 
:'''lo stela''' — lock. '''lo se stela''' — sealed with a lock. '''lo te stela''' — locking mechanism. 
:'''i ti stela ti noi tanxe vau lo ka te setca lo mapti ckiku''' — ''This is a lock for sealing this box; a suitable key is to be inserted into it.''
:Comment: x<sub>3</sub> describes how this mechanism works to open/close x<sub>1</sub>.
:Related words: {ckiku}
column7: x1 cabra lo ka jai gau stodi fai x2 lo ka ganlo i lo vorme e lo gacri e lo dacru e lo pagbu be lo taxfu a lo pastu cu mupli lo ka me x2
column25: x<sub>3</sub> describes how this mechanism works to open/close x<sub>1</sub>.
column41: x1 is a lock/seal of/on/for sealing x2 with/by locking mechanism x3 ||| (cf. ckiku)

x1 is x2 steradian(s) [metric unit] in solid angle (default is 1) by standard x3 ||| (cf. centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

column2:
'''stici''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is to the west of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in frame of reference  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

column41: x1 is to the west/western side of x2 according to frame of reference x3 ||| (cf. stuna, berti, snanu, farna)

column2:
'''stidi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  suggests  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x3)</sub>''  to  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo stidi''' — advisor. '''lo se stidi''' — piece of advice, suggestion, proposal. 
:'''i da'i do stidi tu'a ma noi gusta''' — ''What restaurant would you recommend?''
:'''i lo se stidi be le fetsi pu du lo nu daspo le dinju''' — ''Her proposal was to destroy the building.''

column7: x1 friti x2 noi sidbo lo ka zukte ma kau ku'o x3

column2:
'''stika''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  adjusts, makes  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  change, vary in degree  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo se stika''' — adjusted. 
:'''i ro linji ka'e stika lo ka clani ma kau vau ro da''' — ''Any line segment can be changed in its length to any degree.''
:Comment: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
:Related words: {cenba}, {galfi}, {binxo}, {zasni}, {stodi}
column7: x1 gasnu lo nu x2 cenba fi x3
column25: {binxo} describes that entity turns into another entity, {galfi} is @@@to turn one entity into another one@@@. {cenba} describes how entity changes its state while remaining the same entity, {stika} is @@@to make entity change its state@@@.
column41: x1 (event) adjusts/regulates/changes x2 (ka/ni) in amount/degree x3 ||| [non-resultative, causal change; agentive adjust (= tikygau, tikyzu'e)]; (cf. cenba which need not be causal, galfi which is causal and resultative, binxo which need not be causal but is resultative, zasni, stodi)

column2:
'''stizu''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is a seat, bench, chair

column2:

'''sumji''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is the sum of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  plus  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  plus  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(same type as x1)</sub>''  ...

column2:

:'''i mi sumne lo flora''' — ''I feel a flower scent.''

column2:
'''sumti''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''  is an argument, noun / name / pronoun of predicate  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(property of nonce place)</sub>''  filling place  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(text)</sub>''

:'''i lo nu jai gau glare cu tadji lo nu jukpa lo sovda''' — ''Heating is how you cook an egg.''

column2:

column25: for {tapla} the third dimension is uniform and relatively thin, for {karda} the third dimension is insignificant.
column41: x1 is a tile/cake [shape/form] of material x2, shape x3, thickness x4 ||| [a tile is a 3-dimensional object, relatively uniform and significant in the 3rd dimension, but thin enough that its shape in the the other two dimensions is a significant feature; 'city block' is conceptually a tile; polygon (= taplytai or kardytai - shaped like an approximately-2-dimensional block, lijyclupa - a loop composed of lines)]; (cf. bliku, kubli, matci; karda, for which the 3rd dimension is insignificant, bliku, kurfa, matci, plita, tarmi)

column2:

'''tatpi''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  is tired of  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(clause, property of x1)</sub>''

column2:
'''tavla''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  talks to  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  about  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(entity, text)</sub>''  in language  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''

column41: x1 talks/speaks to x2 about subject x3 in language x4 ||| [not limited to vocal speech, but this is implied by the x4 without context of some other medium of conversation (use cusku, casnu, skicu, ciksi for weaker implication of vocal communication); converse/discuss/chat (= simta'a, simsku, vricysimta'a for a conversation not clearly delimited by subject)]; (cf. bacru, cusku for actual expression, casnu, darlu, skicu, ciksi, bangu)

column2:
'''tcena''' — ''x<sub>1</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  extends to range  ''x<sub>2</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>''  in  ''x<sub>3</sub><sub>(property of x1)</sub>''  from range  ''x<sub>4</sub><sub>(entity)</sub>'' 
:'''lo tcena''' — stretchy. 
:'''i lo bratu carvi cu tcena fo ti fe lo drata gugde lo vlile''' — ''The violent hail spreads from here to another country.''
